loans.use: to pay the rent on the land where he will cultivate corn, beans, millet and bananas.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. Erlinda has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines.

Erlinda requested a PHP 17,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy additional stocks of ready to wear to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of ready to wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Phi

texts.en:
Phi is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock his general store. This purchase will help him to better meet the needs of his customers. His previous loan enabled him to improve his business and offer his customers a greater variety of products.
He hopes that his new loan will assist him in increasing the size of his store and increasing sales, and will also help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock his store.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a hog raising business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Hope

texts.en:
Hope is 32 years old and married with one child. With one child currently in school, Hope works very hard to provide for the family.

Hope runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, snack foods, soft drinks, cooking oil, etc. in her general store.

Hope has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, snack foods, soft drinks, cooking oil, etc. 

In the future, Hope would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, snack foods, soft drinks, cooking oil, etc. in her general store

loans.name: Hoi

texts.en:
Hoi, 42, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money through selling waste materials.

Hoi has been running a general store in front of her house for fifteen years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying different products, such as food and beverages, to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy products like food and beverages to better satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Ailyn Andrea

texts.es: Ailyn de 21 años de edad habita, habita con su cónyuge y su hija de 3 años de edad, al sur de la ciudad, en un sector que combina espacios habitacionales, conformados por casas y conjuntos residenciales y donde se encuentra ubicado uno de los escenarios de futbol  más importantes  de Colombia, y juegan los equipos profesionales del balompié, siendo el Junior el equipo de la Ciudad y de la Costa norte Colombiana.  Allí Ailyn tiene un granero, y vende víveres, ranchos, enlatados, embutidos, verduras y artículos desechables; su idea de negocio nació hace 8 años y  procede de su origen turco por parte de su madre, para quien  las actividades comerciales son su fortaleza. Sus ventas las hace de contado, diariamente y abre sus puertas, para atender al público, desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, mientras sus compras las hace a mayoristas de la ciudad, quienes le ofrecen oportunidades de obtener descuentos y ser más competitiva. En la medida en que su mercado crece, los recursos de compra son insuficientes para acceder a estas oportunidades. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará artículos de la canasta familiar como arroz, aceite, enlatados, embutidos y también productos desechables.   Con su inversión credikiva su capital de trabajo aumentará y podrá lograr compras en mayor volumen y a un precio mas competitivo, que le permite mayor sostenibilidad en su mercado, pues la competencia es su mayor desafio, cuando no tiene sufucuente capital de trabajo para realizar las compras.
texts.en:
Ailyn is 21 years old and lives with her partner and her 3 year old daughter in the south of the city, in an area which is made up of houses and residential blocks. It is also where one of the most important football stadiums of Colombia is found, and where professional football teams, such as Junior, the team of the city and of the north coast of Colombia, play.

Here is where Ailyn has a general store, where she sells foodstuffs, snacks, tins, cold meats, vegetables and disposable items. Her business idea came about 8 years ago through the Turkish roots from her mother, whose strong point was her business activities. Her sales are all cash sales. She opens her store daily to serve the public from 7 o'clock in the morning until 10 o'clock at night. 

She buys her stock wholesale in the city, where she has the opportunity to obtain discounts and can offer more competitive prices. As her market grows, her buying capacity is now not enough to access these opportunities. This is why she is requesting a loan, her first loan cycle with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With this loan she will buy basic family shopping basket items such as rice, oil, tins, cold meats and disposable products.

With this loan her work capital will increase and she will be able to buy in greater volume and at a more competitive price, which will give her greater sustainability in her market, as competition is her greatest challenge when she does not have enough work capital to buy her products.

loans.use: to buy basic family shopping basket items such as rice, oil, tins, cold meats and disposable products.

loans.name: Maria Elenita

texts.en:
Maria Elenita is a 40 year old widow woman from Anda, Bohol. She has three children. The youngest child is seven while the oldest is 18. She owns a variety store in her community. She sells items such as sugar, beverages, detergents, toiletries and soft drinks. Aside from managing a retail store, she raises hogs. She has been raising hogs for five years.

She requested a loan of 29,000 PHP to buy additional stock for the store and to purchase feeds and pig supplements. In the future, Maria Elenita would like to expand her business to support her three children and at the same time to be able to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for the store and to purchase  feeds and pig supplements.

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha, 41, is married and has three children: one son and two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income running a general store in front of their house. 

She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung is requesting a new loan to buy sewing tools and materials. Dung's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She  hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying more sewing materials.

loans.name: Sari Mertha Group

texts.en:
To continue to develop their businesses, the Sari Mertha group continue taking loans. The group has three new members and the group is now composed of 13 members. 

This loan will be used to buy local piglets and superior piglets. Ni Luh already has a sow, so her loan will be used to buy food for pigs and fix the pig-pen. Because her pig-pen is now too small to accommodate all her pigs, the piglets are left free in her garden. She hopes that the pig-pen will be fixed immediately so the piglets do not roam and disturb neighbors. With this effort, Ni Luh is supporting her husband to fulfill their family's needs. 

Ni Luh and one other member could not attend the meeting. The woman raising her hand in the picture is the group's treasurer, Ni Ketut.

loans.use: To buy food for pigs and fix the pig-pen.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga, 50, is married and has three children, one son and two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income as a driver for hire. 

Nga started a cafe 30 years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of soft drinks and coffee to better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and coffee.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 42 years old and is married with eight children.

Imelda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional goods like candies, snack foods, sugar, bread, cooking oil, noodles, etc. to sell in her general store.

Imelda has borrowed and paid back four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns additional income from basket-weaving.

Imelda aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional goods like candies, snack foods, sugar, bread, cooking oil and noodles to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh is 33 years old and is widowed with two daughters. Thanh has been running a general store in front of her door for two years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her children. She lives with her children in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Thanh is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more household items and many kinds of soft drinks to stock her store. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more household items and many kinds of soft drinks to stock her store.

loans.name: Lit

texts.en:
Lit, 46 years old, is married and has two children, one son and one daughter. She and her husband support their family through the income they earn from selling steel wire. They have been in this business for fifteen years. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Lit intends to take a loan to increase her working capital and buy steel wire to stock her store. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy steel wire to sell.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong is a 48-year-old married woman. She lives with two children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. For thirteen years, she and her husband have run a sewing shop selling clothes and other products to people in her community.

Phuong would like a loan to purchase better quality sewing materials. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To buy better quality sewing materials.

loans.name: Tuan

texts.en:
Tuan is 40 years old and single. He earns income through a business of selling food. Tuan has run this business for five years. He lives in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Tuan intends to take a loan to expand his business by buying a variety of different foods to sell to his customers. 

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a variety of different foods to sell.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace works hard to support her family. Mary Grace is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Mary Grace requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like soft drinks, canned goods, coffee, milk, snack foods and other groceries to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Mary Grace would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like soft drinks, canned goods, coffee, milk, snack foods and other groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong, 44, is married and has three children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a worker in a local company. She earns an income running a general store in front of her house. 

Hong started this business ten years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food and beverages.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang, 40, is married and has three children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband helps her to run a food stall to sell pork and noodles for people in their community. 

Hang started this activity a year ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying better quality foods such as noodles, pork and vegetables to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy noodles, pork and vegetables to better satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Lorena Lourdes

texts.es:
Lorena  tiene 40 años de edad, es viuda y tiene un hijo. Vive en casa de su mamá, con su hijo de 9 años de edad, quien se encuentra estudiando. Ella es viuda desde hace seis años y desde entonces esta luchando sola por su hijo. Desde hace 15 años ella administra su propia tienda de papelería y útiles escolares. La mercadería la adquiere en una ciudad que esta ubicada a 77 kilómetros de distancia, el recorrido lo hace en autobús una vez por semana; ella manifiesta que quisiera hacerlo dos veces a la semana pero por falta de dinero no lo puede hacer. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar papel de todo tipo, colores y tamaño, útiles escolares de mayor variedad. Ella desea comprar a tiempo la mercadería ya que posee una gran demanda y se queda sin producto y eso le hace perder ingresos. Su gran propósito es mantener su negocio en crecimiento para poderlo expandir a otros zonas y que su hijo estudie en la universidad.
texts.en:
Lorena is 40 years old, she is a widow and has one son. She lives at home with her mother and her 9 year old son, who studies at school. She was widowed six years ago and since then has fought to raise her son alone. For the past 15 years she runs her own stationery and school supplies store. She buys her stock in a city which is located 77 kilometres away. She travels there by bus once a week. She would like to go twice a week but cannot due to lack of money.

The loan she is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy all sorts of paper of different colours and sizes and a variety of school utensils. She wants to buy her stock in time as she has high demand for it and often runs out which makes her lose possible income. Her greatest goals are to keep seeing business grow in order to extend it to other areas and to see her son studying at university.

loans.use: to buy all sorts of paper of different colours and sizes and a variety of school utensils.

loans.name: La Victoire 9 Group

texts.fr: LA VICTOIRE 9 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des cohabitantes. La représentante du groupe, Albertine est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Albertine est âgée de 43 ans est mariée à Lookman, un meunier. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous à leur charge et dont certains sont scolarisés. Albertine et Lookman vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. Le couple assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Albertine n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Albertine vend des produits divers (riz, savon, sucre, sardine, huile) et du charbon de bois son domicile. Albertine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir sans grande difficulté, à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille. Albertine et les autres membres du groupe LA VICTOIRE 9 sollicitent pour une première fois, l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
La Victoire 9 is a group of three people, of which the members all live together. The representative of the group, Albertine, is the one whose hand is raised in the photo. Albertine is 43 years old and is married to a Lookman, a miller. The couple has five children, all under their care. Some of the children go to school. Albertine and Lookman live together with their children. Together, the couple takes care of the different household expenses. Albertine did not go to school.

Albertine sells various goods (rice, soap, sugar, sardines, oil) and charcoal from her home. She procures her goods in a market in Benin. This business allows her to support her and her family's needs without much difficulty. 

Albertine and the other members of the La Victoire 9 group are seeking for their first time financial support from Alide in order to increase their working capital and their business, and to better respond to the needs of their customers.

loans.use: to buy charcoal, vegetable oil, and other goods

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Gracias por apoyar a Luis con su credikiva, con el pudo comprar accesorios fotográficos, como lentes, teleobjetivos, flash y cámaras fotográficas, así sus ventas aumentaron y también sus utilidades. Hoy vive más tranquilo porque sus recursos financieros a los que accede,  son a más bajo costo y puede financiar el negocio más fácilmente, como le ocurre con su credikiva. 
En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el que comprará cámaras fotográficas y accesorios como flash, teleobjetivos trípodes, herramienta de sostén a fin de evitar el movimiento. Su inversión planea ser muy exitosa porque mejorará su infraestructura modernizándola para obtener unos mejores registros y calidad en el servicio que ofrece sintiéndose muy contento por estar a la medida de lo que requiere su clientela..
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Luis with this loan. With it he was able to buy camera accessories such as lenses, zoom lenses, flashes, and cameras. Due to this, his sales increased and so did his services. Now he lives with greater peace of mind because the financial resources he accesses are low cost and he can finance his business easily, as with this loan.

At the moment, he is requesting a new loan, with which he will buy cameras and photography accessories such as flashes, zoom lenses, tripods, tools to avoid movement. He hopes this investment will be very successful as it will improve his infrastructure by modernizing it in order to obtain better range and quality in the services he offers. He feels very happy to be able to live up to the expectations of what his customers require.

loans.use: to buy cameras and photography accessories such as flashes, zoom lenses, tripods, tools to avoid movement.

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr: Adjovi vit avec son mari à Lomé. Âgée de 33ans, elle revend des tissus batik qu’elle expose sur étalage dans un marché de la ville de Lomé. démarré l’activité en 2007, Adjovi s’y plait bien car cela lui permet de se prendre en charge et de contribuer au besoin de la famille. Son premier crédit lui permettra d’acheter des tissus. Le profit l’aidera à disposer d’une boutique et pour assurer les besoins primaires de ses futurs progénitures.
texts.en:
Adjovi lives with her husband in Lome. Aged 33 years old, she sells batik fabric that she puts on display in a Lome town market. She has been in this business since 2007, and she likes it because it allows her to support and contribute to her family's needs. 

Her first loan will allow her to buy fabric. The earnings will help her to set up a shop and to ensure the basic needs of her future children.

loans.use: to buy batik fabric

loans.name: Franco

texts.es: Franco, de 25 años de edad , esta casado con Mónica y junto a ella tiene un pequeño hijo de tan solo 1 año de edad, trabaja mucho pues desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia a quienes protege y cuida en su casa propia.El trabajo de Franco consiste en el transporte de pasajeros dentro y fuera de la ciudad, está siempre presto para movilizar a cualquier cliente que desea llegar sano y salvo a su destino pues una de sus virtudes es ser muy cuidadoso y protector. Lleva realizado éste trabajo por 3 años .Le gusta su trabajo pues le permite tener tiempo para estar a lado de su familia en los momentos que se siente agotado, recuerda que empezó con éste trabajo muy joven y poco a poco fue ganando experiencia gracias a los días de trabajo que a veces se tornan muy incómodos por el clima pero espera seguir trabajando con la misma fuerza de siempre por el bien de su familia.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 300 para refaccionar su mototaxi, es por eso que agradece a quienes hacen posible este financiamiento que le ayudará a cumplir con sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Franco is 25 years old and is married to Monica. Together they have a young son who is just one year old. Franco works hard as he wants to offer his family a better quality of life and to protect and care for them in his own house. Franco's jobs consists in transporting passengers in and out of the city. He is always ready to transport anyone who wants to arrive safe and sound to their destination. One of his virtues is that he is very caring and protective. He has worked in this activity for the past 3 years. He enjoys his job as it allows him to have time to be with his family during the moments when he is exhausted. He remembers that he started out with this job when he was very young and little by little gained experience thanks to the days he spent working. Sometimes these days become very uncomfortable due to the climate but he hopes to continue working with the same energy as always for the sake of his family.

On this occasion he is requesting a loan of 300 PEN to renovate his mototaxi. He is grateful to those who make this financing possible as it will help him fulfil his goals.

loans.use: to renovate his mototaxi.

loans.name: Bach

texts.en:
Bach is 38 years old, and is married with one daughter. She has been running a general store in front of her house for 15 years. She started this business to cover her expenses, and raise her child. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.
Bach is requesting a loan to expand her business by offering more food and many kinds of soft drinks so that she will be able to increase sales. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy food and many kinds of soft drinks to stock in her store.

loans.name: Hung

texts.en:
Hung is a 52-year-old married man. He lives with his daughter and wife in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife earns money by running a general store.
For thirty years, he has run a business processing and selling leather to make leather products. He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying a greater variety of leather to increase his sales.
He hopes his business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy and process leather for selling.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong is 55 years old and is married. She has 7 children and lives with them and husband in Ho Chi Minh City.
She and her husband have been raising and selling pigs for 5 years. She intends to use her loan to buy food stuff and buy more baby pigs.
She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and allow her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy foodstuff and more baby pigs to raise.

loans.name: Gigliola

texts.es:
Gigliola  de 33 años de edad habita con su cónyuge y su hijo de 4 años, en la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde se disfruta  la amabilidad de su gente y es  posiblemente el lugar del país que más inmigrantes extranjeros y de Colombia misma ha recibido, lo que han hecho de esta una ciudad de la mas variada idiosincrasia.  
Alli  en Barranquilla, llamada la Puerta de oro de Colombia, Gigliola desde hace 3 años, se dedica  a la venta de víveres, ranchos, lácteos, perfumería, calzado y todos los artículos, que su mixta clientela solicita diariamente. Su negocio tiene como principales clientes a vecinos, familias y amigos,   a quienes vende de contado y a crédito, con una frecuencia de cada dos días, en las que realiza sus actividades desde las 8 de la mañana, hasta las 12 del medio día. Su meta poco a poco es lograr el crecimiento de su negocio y el incremento de sus utilidades y mas adelante tener casa propia y proveerle a su hijo estudios de calidad, para que tenga un gran potencial de éxito. 
En la actualidad su mayor desafío es tener suficiente capital e trabajo, para dar curso al ensanche de su negocio, y esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el cual comprará víveres como arroz, aceite y mercancías, encargadas como colonias calzado y cremas. Con esta inversión responderá a las expectativas de su clientela, a quien busca fidelizar cada vez mas con un servicio oportuno.
texts.en:
33-year-old Gigliola lives with her spouse and her four-year-old son in the city of Barranquilla, where the people are friendly. It is possibly the place in the country which has received the most immigrants from other countries and from other parts of Colombia, which has made this a city of the most varied idiosyncrasies. 

In Barranquilla, called the Golden Gate of Colombia, Gigliola has made a living for three years by selling supplies, food, dairy products, perfume, footwear, and all manner of items which her clientele request daily. Her business’ main customers are neighbours, family, and friends, to whom she sells in cash or on credit. She works every second day from eight in the morning until midday. Her goal is to achieve growth in her business and an increase in profit, and later to have her own house and provide her son with a quality education so that he has great potential to succeed.

Currently her greatest challenge is to have enough working capital in order to allow for the expansion of her business, and this is the reason she is applying for a loan with Kiva, her first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  with which she will buy supplies, such as rice and oil, and pre-ordered merchandise, such as cologne, footwear, and creams. With this investment she will respond to the expectations of her clientele, of whom she looks to make faithful clients by providing a convenient service.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, such as rice and oil, and pre-ordered merchandise, such as cologne, footwear, and creams

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 65 years old, and married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.
Erlinda has a fishing business in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials like wood, paints, bamboo, etc. for the repair of her fishing boat.
She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her fishing business.
Erlinda has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials like wood, paints, bamboo, etc. for the repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a 51-year-old married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Monica has a basket weaving business in the Philippines. Monica requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her business.
Monica has been in this business for 4 years. Monica would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her basket weaving.

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van is 40 years old and married with two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income as a driver for hire. Van started a food stall to sell breakfast meals to her customers 10 years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying furniture for her food stall to better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en: Delfina is a 55-year-old married woman from Anda, Bohol. She has 3 grown children. She owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store in her community. She sells sugar, noodles, biscuits, seasonings, soaps and soft drinks. She has been operating the store for almost 20 years. She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy additional stocks like coffee, canned goods, toiletries and cooking oil to cater to the increasing needs of the customers. In the future, Delfina would like to expand her business to improve their livelihood status.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like coffee, canned goods, toiletries and  cooking oil to cater to the needs of her customers.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
This is Carmelita. Her previous loan was a big help to her business. She was able to buy more products for her business and she was able to generate more income. The loan helped not just her business but also with their family expenses. She has had this business for four years now. She and her husband, who is a driver, work hard to provide income for their everyday needs.
She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add into her current inventory. The more items displayed in the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.
Carmelita dreams that her other members of the family will have businesses also. She hopes that her business will continue to grow. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Soeurn's Group

texts.en: Soeurn is a 58-year-old rural villager from the Sangke district of Battambang province. She is a widow and has four children who are no longer under her dependency. She has been running her tailoring business for 10 years and is able to earn 23,700 KHR as a current daily average income to support her living expenses. Being with Kiva’s partner VisionFund she can manage to uplift her living conditions in a proper manner better than before and expand her business. Now, she has shortage of working capital to support her business. Therefore, she is applying for a new loan to buy more fabrics for her tailoring business. She hopes to gain more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 46 years old, a devoted mother of two children, who is engaged in a retailing business. Violeta has run her sari-sari store business for 26 years. Her duration of managing the business contributes to the knowledge of running the business.
As a responsible parent she wants the best for her children. Violeta is driven to work harder because she found a new goal in life. Violeta’s goal is to earn higher income and save it for her child’s placement fee who wants to work abroad. Because of this, Violeta is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy grocery items like toothpaste, shampoo, powder, juice and beverages to sell. Violeta hopes that someday her children will have a good future.

loans.use: to buy grocery items like toothpaste, shampoo, powder, juice and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 52 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.
Elma buys and sells recycled materials in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of recycled materials for her business.
Elma has been in this business for 20 years.
In the future Elma would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of recycled materials for her business.

loans.name: Lon's Group

texts.en: Originally from Battambang province, Lon is a 48-year-old mother of seven children. Currently, four of her children are still in school and remaining three are working as paid workers. To deal with the daily cost of living, she sells fish and her husband is a construction worker. She has been engaged in the current business for 10 years. With VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, she is the nine-cycled client. After the last loan which she has repaid back completely, she feels so empowered that she can sustain her living status in proper condition. Now, she is in need of working capital, so she formed a group of four to apply for a new loan. She is seeking for 1,400,000 KHR while her co-borrowers are seeking for 1,000,000 KHR. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy construction materials to support her husband’s occupation. She hopes that she and her husband can make more profit and keep her children in school until tertiary level.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to support her husband’s occupation.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
This is Rosemarie, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Sony, her business partner and a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.
Rosemarie operates a food stall. She sells arroz caldo (Chinese congee) and barbecue. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like pork, rice, condiments and seasonings.
Rosemarie dreams of being successful in business and hopes to have a happy family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, and other ingredients needed in her food stall.

loans.name: Choeurn's Group

texts.en: Choeurn is 35 years old, married and blessed with four children. Her and the rest of her family rely on their rice cropping business in the Sangke district of Battambang province, where they reside. To supplement the family’s income, her husband also catches fish to sell. The 10 year engagement in the current business earns her about 27,500 KHR per day. This is the fifth cycle for Choeurn’s group which consists of two members. The past loan, which she has fully repaid back, has improved her lifestyle progressively. Now, she and her joint member are requesting 1,400,000 KHR each. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and gasoline to pump water. She hopes that she can expand her business on a larger scale and make triple the income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and gasoline to pump water.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene, who is married and has operated a general store business in the Philippines for two years, works hard to support her family. She has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, and spices. In the future, Irene would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, and spices.

loans.name: Roem's Group

texts.en: Roem, a 41-year-old mother of three children, is a local farmer residing in the Sangke district of Battambang province. She has tackled her family‘s financial burden by catching fish to sell. Her husband also helps her to earn more income from his occupation as a construction worker. The 10 year involvement in the current business earns her about 41,000 KHR per day. The two cycles ago was her first loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She has repaid back her past loan with success and it has enabled her to relieve her family’s burden and improve their livelihood. For this cycle, she formed a group of two to apply for a new loan. She, as the group leader, will use her loan portion to buy fishing nets and a fish trap. She hopes that this equipment will help her to catch more fish and earn more income.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and a fish trap.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
This is Ligaya. She previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more vegetables. Her earnings were a big help for her children's education and for their personal, household and business expenditures. She also has a variety store and she sells pork.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to purchase more vegetables needed in her business. She will also use the loan to buy grocery items and more pork. Profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Ligaya hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for vegetables and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 18 years. She earns more income from hog raising. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase materials like nylon thread, rope and other materials for fishing nets and materials for her fishing business.  She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase materials like nylon thread, rope and other materials for fishing nets and other materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.en:
Socorro, a 58-year-old married mother of five children, one of whom is in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur in the Philippines. For 11 years now, she has had a business making fishing nets and is requesting a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy more net-making materials.

In the future, Socorro would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for making fishing nets.

loans.name: Theourm's Group

texts.en:
A widowed mother of six children from Battambang province, Theourm is 52 years old and depends solely on a single business, catching fish to sell. She has been with this business for five years and is able to get about 26,000 KHR per day. 

This is Theourm's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to take out a new loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fishing net and a small boat. She hopes this purchase will help her to catch more fish and earn more income.

loans.use: To buy fishing net and a small boat.

loans.name: Aisa

texts.en:
Aisa is 25 years old and married with two children who are in school. Aisa works very hard to provide for them.
Aisa buys and sells pearls in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of pearl to sell.
Aisa has been in this business for 13 years.
In the future, Aisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of pearl to sell.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is married with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Geraldine is 43 years old and has three children who are in school.
Geraldine has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Geraldine requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.
Geraldine has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Geraldine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.
She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for the maintenance of her motorcycle.
Juvy has been in this business for 5 years. Juvy earns additional income from a general store.
Juvy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion works hard to support her family. Salvacion is married and sells used clothing in the Philippines.
Salvacion requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional used clothing to sell.
Salvacion has been in this business for 5 years now.
In the future, Salvacion would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional used clothing.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina, a 62-year-old married mother of eight, is a very hardworking entrepreneur with a fishing business in the Philippines. In business for 10 years, she has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

In the future, Rosalina would like to build and expand her enterprise to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 41 years old, married and has three children who are in school. 
Teodora is in the agricultural business of hog raising in the Philippines. Teodora requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.
Teodora has been raising hogs for eight years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.
In the future, Teodora would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline works hard to support her family. Angeline is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.
Angeline requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.
Angeline has been in this business for 2 years now.
In the future, Angeline would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria works hard to support her family. Victoria is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.
Victoria requested a PHP 18,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.
Victoria has been in this business for 5 years now.
In the future, Victoria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
This is Marilou, whose previous loan was a big help in her retail business. She was able to buy more toy products and candies for her enterprise, resulting in additional income which helped in the education of her children.

Marilou is requesting another 17,000 PHP loan to buy an additional stock of toy products and candies. The resulting increase in profits will definitely help her to sustain the family's daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marilou dreams of having her own stall and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners gathering each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for an additional stock of toy products and candies needed in her business.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
This is Carmen. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy the needed spare parts for her tricycle. The loan also helped with her family's needs. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.
She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.
Carmen hopes to have a new motorcycle. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Tukad Kemiri Group

texts.en:
The Tukad Kemiri group is made up of 5 women who are neighbors in the same village in Pemuteran, North Bali. The group is seeking a loan of 5M IDR, and each member will receive 1M IDR. The group was formed out of these women’s common interest in raising pigs to support their families, and out of their interest in educating others on the best practices for pig raising. This is their first loan with MUK.
Ni Nyoman, is the head of the Tukad Kemiri group. She plans to use her share of the loan to purchase 2 superior piglets for fattening. Over the six-month loan period, she hopes to have fat and healthy pigs. She will sell the pigs in six months. With her income, she hopes to be able to fulfill their daily needs and save as well.

loans.use: to purchase 2 superior piglets for fattening.

loans.name: Prathna's Group

texts.en:
A father of four schoolchildren living in Sangke district of Battambang province, Prathna is 37 years old and a rice farmer on a two hectare area to support his living. He has been involved with this business for seven years. To earn extra income, his wife sells vegetables in the local area. This is the fifth cycle loan for Prathna with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  He utilized his past loan wisely to maintain his living status in a proper condition, and he has repaid back all of his past loans. 

Now, he is forming a group of three to apply for a new loan. The total loan amount of his requesting group is 3,600,000 KHR. Prathna, whose loan portion is 1,400,000 KHR, will purchase fertilizer and rice seed for his farmland and also pay a plowing fee. Additionally, he will use the loan money to buy more vegetables for his wife to sell. He hopes that he can earn more income and set aside some money to buy an additional plot of farmland to expand his rice cropping business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed, and to pay a plowing fee.

loans.name: Shiela Marie

texts.en: Shiela Marie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years now. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell, like laundry soap, cooking oil, snack foods, coffee, soft drinks and other groceries. In the future, Shiela Marie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell, like laundry soap, cooking oil, snack foods, coffee, soft drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Thet's Group

texts.en:
Thet is 47 years old and married with four children, some of whom are still in school while some are helping in the family’s business. Thet is a peasant from Battambang province where she and her family live in a residential area. She manages five hectares for growing rice, and her husband also works as a paid worker during his spare time after helping her on the farmland. She has been with this business for 30 years. 

Thet has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past three loan cycles. The past loans have stabilized her living status to a proper condition. She has managed to pay back her past loans with success. For this cycle, she is in a group of two to apply for a new loan. She is seeking 1,400,000 KHR and her joint member is applying for 600,000 KHR. 

As the group leader, Thet will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay a plowing fee. She hopes to gain a high yield and make more profit so she can buy a mini-tractor to support her farmland and reduce the plowing fees which she used to pay to others.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay a plowing fee.

loans.name: Servando

texts.en:
This is Servando. He previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that he used to buy spare parts, accessories and for the maintenance of his Jeepney unit. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in his family's personal, household and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan for him to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of his Jeepney unit. He will also use the loan to buy grocery items for his wife's variety store. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Servando hopes that his business will grow even more and that his children will have a beautiful future. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from study of the Word of God. 


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and the maintenance of his jeepney vehicle.

loans.name: Eutiquia

texts.en:
Eutiquia is a 60-year-old married woman from Carlos P. Garcia, Bohol. She has three grown children. 

She engages in fishing. She sells fish, crabs, shrimps and sea shells. Her husband is a fisherman. Eutiquia sells the catch with her husband. This is the family's source of income. She has been doing this fishing for 10 years.

She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy fish net, nylon and an engine for the motor boat to increase the volume of catch. 

In the future, Eutiquia would like to invest in other business ventures to improve their livelihood and save for old age.

loans.use: to buy fish net, nylon and an engine for the motor boat.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is grateful for the first loan she received through Milango. It helped her restock the business and attracted many customers. The family now enjoys a constant source of income. 

She would like to increase the operations of the business and is applying for a loan of 83,500 Kenya shillings to buy hair oils, shampoos and other forms of cosmetics. She will plough back the income into the business.

loans.use: To buy shampoo and hair oil.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 56 years old, married and has 12 children, four of whom are in school.

Rosalina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosalina has been raising pigs for three years now and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Rosalina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Rosalina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
This is Arlene. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy all the needed materials for her business. As a result, her income increased and it helped a lot in the education of her children. She and her husband are continuously working for their family's future. They also sell chlorine for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy paint, screens, and shirts as well as clothing and other items for her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Arlene dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week where she finds strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for paint, screens, and shirts as well as clothing and other items for her business.

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is grateful for the first loan she received from the lenders. It helped her increase the stock of roofing materials and the retail food business. 

She would like to add stock of fruits and other grocery into the business. She is asking for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to buy additional retail stock like soap, flour, cooking oil, etc. 

She looks forward to educating her children from the extra income she aspires to receive from this loan.

loans.use: To buy additional retail stock like soap, flour, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Jotham

texts.en:
Jotham is a married businessman living in the Kilifi area of Coast province, Kenya. He has one child and runs a middle-level training college that has been in operation for four years. Besides this, he is also formally employed.

Jotham is asking for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to buy a computer for the college. He believes this will help him offer better education, attract more students and earn more income that he will eventually use to improve the living standard of his family. 

He previously had the challenge of lack of capital, which he now sees partly sorted out by joining Milango.

loans.use: To buy a computer for the college.

loans.name: Floriana

texts.en:
Floriana is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water.

Floriana operates a charcoal-selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of high cost of obtaining a license for the business. Floriana dreams of expanding her business to wholesale in the future.

With the KES 40,000, she wants to purchase 30 bags of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to invest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase 30 bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer is grateful for the first loan she received from Milango. Her fish business has grown into a food stall. She started by mainly selling fish. Because of the first loan, she has obtained a high income that helped her repay the loan on time while also meeting other family needs. She previously had financial challenges which she has sorted out by joining Milango.
She is asking for a loan of 107,250 to buy dry fish for sale. She now looks forward to opening other outlets.

loans.use: to purchase dry fish for sale

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a beauty salon business; her potential customers are women. She faces a challenge of stiff competition in her business. Josephine dreams of expanding her business and offering suitable services to her customers.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase cosmetics and hair weaves for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and hair weaves for her business.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn works hard to support her family. Arlyn is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Arlyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like soap, snack foods, spices, sugar, milk, etc..

Arlyn has been in this business for a year now.

In the future, Arlyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like soap, snack foods, spices, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
Joana  is married and is 26 years old. 

She is living in a town near the school, and she is running a kiosk in the market. Her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy including students. 

She is applying for a loan of $1,000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as clothing, pans, books and rice. 

She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future.

loans.use: To buy clothing, pans, books and rice.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 51 years old and married. She has eight children, two of whom are currently in school. Fely works very hard to provide for them.

Fely runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, soap, eggs, noodles, etc to sell.

Fely has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Fely would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, soap, eggs, noodles, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
This is Vilma. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan of 20,000 PHP to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Vilma hopes that her children will finish their studies and dreams that her business will continue to grow. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: José Melecio

texts.es:
José tiene 55 años, esta casado y tiene once hijos. Vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos, se caso a la edad de 34 años de edad. Él aprendió el oficio de la elaboración de hamacas desde que se caso; pues fue ella quien le enseño y desde entonces trabajan en esa actividad, después de elaborarlas las comercializa y también las hace por encargo. Él junto a su esposa e hijos elaborar de 6 a 8 hamacas a la semana. Antes solo se dedicaba a los trabajos agrícolas a sembrar maíz, fríjol y maicillo; hoy en día sigue sembrando estos granos básicos junto a sus hijos para consumo familiar. 

Los insumos para elaborar hamacas las adquiere en una ciudad, que para llegar ahí aborda dos autobuses; viaja cada 8 o 15 días según sea el movimiento de las hamacas, en ese mismo lugar adquiere los insumos agrícolas. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar abono, foliares, fungicidas y pago del alquiler del terreno en donde sembrara maíz, frijoles y maicillo. De esta manera, don José podrá cultivar para obtener el grano para consumo de su familia y la otra parte la venderá. Su objetivo es construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
José, age 55, is married and has 11 children.  He lives with his wife and children.  He got married when he was 34.  He learned the trade of making hammocks when he got married.  She was the one who taught him, and since then he has worked at this business activity.

After making them, he sells them, and he also makes them by order.  Together with his wife and children, he makes six to eight hammocks a week.  Before, he only used to do agricultural work, growing corn, beans, and sorghum.  Nowadays he continues growing these basic crops together with his children.  The crops are for the family’s consumption.

He gets the supplies to make the hammocks in a city.  In order to get there he has to take two buses.  He travels every 8 or 15 days, according to the movement of the hammocks.  This is the same place where he gets the agricultural supplies.

The loan that he is requesting from the Fundación Campo is to buy manure, leaf fertilizers, and fungicides.  He will also use the loan to pay the rent on the land where he grows the corn, beans, and sorghum.  This way José will be able to cultivate in order to get the crops for his family’s consumption.  He will sell the other part.

His objective is to build his own house.

loans.use: to buy manure, leaf fertilizers, and fungicides, and to pay the rent on the land where he grows the corn, beans, and sorghum.

loans.name: Martinha

texts.en:
Martinha is taking a loan of $ 1000 to improve her business. She is married and she is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits. 

She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $ 80. She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future. Her husband is a teacher.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator, salt, water, soft drinks, and books.

loans.name: Rene Humberto

texts.es: Rene de 36 años vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en casa propia, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 8 años siembra los principales granos basicos: frijol y maiz y con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es un hombre responsable, honesto y trabajador. El esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha y poder pagar el alguiler de parcela que muestra en la fotografia donde siembra sus cultivos ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi tener mejores ingresos y tener un mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Thirty-six year-old Rene lives with his wife and their 3 children in their own house. 

He has earned a living working in agriculture for the past 8 years. He plants the main basic grains: beans and corn. With the sale of his harvests he manages to cover household expenses. He is a responsible, honest and hard-working man. 

He is asking for a loan to be able to buy supplies for his harvest and to pay the rent on the parcel of land where he plants his crops shown in the photograph. The money he earns is not enough to cover these costs. This way he will have a better income and will be more economically stable.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies (manure, seeds, etc.)

loans.name: Uhuru Group

texts.en:
Zaika, who is in her mid-30s, is divorced from her husband. She is taking care of her three children who are in school. She has had a business selling clothes door-to-door for period of three years now. She is doing fine in this project and the family also. Zaika works from 6am to 4pm daily and she is able to earn a small profit per month. 

This will be Zaika's third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of which she paid back successfully, she managed to increase her business stocks to attract more customers. With the income generated, she covered the family's basic needs together with school fees. She will use this loan to increase the stock in her business. She dreams of having good accommodation and building a nice house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "UHURU" which totals 10 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the stock in her business.

loans.name: Mumo

texts.en:
Mumo is a married woman with two school-going children. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a second-hand clothes business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in sales of clothes in her business.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a 40-year-old married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She has seven children. The oldest child is 16 while the youngest is one year old. She operates a motorcycle transport business. Her husband is the one who transports the passengers from one place to remote areas. She has been operating the motorcycle transport service for five years. 

She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy spare parts and pay for motorcycle maintenance to avoid delays and hassle during the operation of the business. In the future, Evangeline would like to expand her business to improve their livelihood status and at the same time to be able to send all her children to school.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and pay for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 49 years old, married, and supports four members of his family.  He has three children, aged between 21 and 15 years old.  He offers 'm-pesa' (mobile money transfer) services in a Kilibwoni location and has been in operation for a period of four years, earning an income of KES 15,000.

He has taken out his first loan of KES.30,000 from KADET LTD which he wishes to use to increase the float of his business.  The profits he earns will be used to pay  school fees for his children.  

His dream is see his business expand and also own tea plantations.

loans.use: To improve the business float

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. They live in Getafe, Bohol. Marlyn has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for more than 10 years now. This is the source of their income. 

Marlyn is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and to pay for the repair of the fishing boat. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Marlyn hopes to make their fishing venture a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and to pay for the repair of the fishing boat.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa acquired a loan before and it was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more products needed in her business thus generating more income. The loan also helped her in her family's everyday needs. She and her husband work hard for their family's future.

She would like to apply for a 60,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jesusa dreams of having another store and hopes to have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children, both of them attending school. She has one additional family member (her mother). Rehema sells old clothes in the market on a daily basis and works seven days a week. She has run her business for six years. 

Rehema has applied for 400,000 UGX to enable her to buy additional clothes. She sells sweet bananas and green bananas as her additional income source. The main challenges for her business are seasonality and ever increasing prices of used clothes. Her goals and aspirations include expanding her business into a wholesale one and also building her own house. She rents the house she lives in, and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more  bales of used clothes

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is a 59-year-old married woman and a mother of six grown-up children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing and seaweed farming business together with her husband for more than 10 years now. This has been their source of income. 

Ma.Fe is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets. lead weights and seaweed seedlings. With this, they will be able to improve their business as well as their income. Ma. Fe believes that they will be able to expand their business through hard work and perseverance.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets. lead weights and seaweed seedlings

loans.name: Odilia

texts.en:
Odilia is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.


For the past four years, Odilia has operated a dressmaking business, selling at the market, mostly to women. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. Odilia dreams of expanding her business to meet her customer’s needs. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase cloth materials, sewing thread and needles for her business. She joined Yehu to access loans to invest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials, sewing thread and needles for her business

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 27 years old and comes from Mamboleo in Kisumu County which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is married to Charles who is a businessman and she is a mother of two children who are eight and five years old.

Ruth has been selling cereals since the year 2011; through her business, she makes a monthly income of KES. 6,000. She is taking out a second loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more stock of dry maize for sale. 


She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business hence create growth.She is hoping to become more stable in her business so as to provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase maize for resale

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.es:
El joven Timoteo tiene 19 años de edad, vive junto a su tía.
Desde muy pequeño se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajadora; ya que con su trabajado a apoyado a su tía y a sus padres, por sus condiciones económicas sus padres tuvieron que pedirle ayuda a su tía para que esta les ayudara a crecerlo.
Hoy día Timoteo es un hombre luchador y trabajador, ya que desde su corta edad de 10 años aprendió al cultivo de la siembra de maíz, frijol, maicillo, lo cual hasta ahora lo sigue haciendo, también trabaja como albañil, y vendiendo leña; ya que con estos diversos trabajos puede hacer un poco mas sus ganancias para su sustento y poder apoyar económicamente a sus familiares.
Gracias a su lucha continua Timoteo ha aprendido diversos oficios, él también  cría cerdos y aves de corral.
El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar dos cerdos pequeños para engordarlos, abono, foliares, fungicidas para cultivar maíz y pago del alquiler del terreno en donde cultiva maíz y frijoles junto con su tía. En un futuro desea construir su propia casa y trabajar cada día más.
texts.en:
Young Timoteo is 19 years old and lives with his aunt.

From very young, he has been characterized as a very hard-working person, since with his work he has supported his aunt and his parents. Because of their economic condition, his parents had to ask his aunt for help to raise him.

Nowadays, Timoteo is a determined and hard-working man, since at 10 years old he learned to grow corn, beans, and sorghum from seeds, which he continues doing up until now. He also works as a construction worker and sells firewood, since with these diverse jobs he can increase his profits for his sustenance and to be able to economically support his family members.

Thanks to his continual struggle, Timoteo has learned diverse trades. He also raises pork and poultry.

The loan that he is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy two small pigs to fatten, compost, fertilizer, and fungicide to grow corn and to pay the rent for the land where he grows corn and beans along with his aunt. In the future he wishes to construct his own home and work more each day.

loans.use: to buy two small pigs to fatten, compost, fertilizer, and fungicide to grow corn and to pay the rent for the land where he grows corn and beans along with his aunt. In the future he wishes to construct his own home and work more each day.

loans.name: Luz Emilia

texts.es: Luz Emilia, había recibido un anterior crédito a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y  con él  logró comprar al por mayor y de contado cervezas y refrescos y los vendió. Con esta inversión pudo continuar con su actividad principal, ya que su capital de trabajo no era suficiente para invertir en mayor volumen. Desde que recibió su primer crédito, tiene más inventario de mercancías y puede  responder la demanda. Ella está muy agradecida por la ayuda, en momentos difíciles para poder salir adelante con su negocio.    En la actualidad Luz Emilia está aplicando a una nueva financiación, con la que comprará un mayor volumen de cervezas y reparará uno de sus enfriadores. Su inversión será exitosa porque tiene muy buena clientela y con esta inversión se incrementará el inventario para atender oportunamente a sus clientes.
texts.en: Luz Emilia received a previous loan via Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, she bought beer and beverages wholesale, paying for them upfront, later selling them. With this investment, she was able to continue with her main activity, since her working capital wasn't enough to invest in a large quantity. Since she received her first loan, she has more inventory of her merchandise and she can respond to demand. She is very grateful for the help in hard times so she can keep going ahead with her business. Right now, Luz Emilia is applying for a new loan. With it, she will buy a larger quantity of beer and repair one of her refrigerators.
