Her investment will be successful because she has a lot of  customers and it will increase her inventory to serve them in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of beer and repair one of her refrigerators.

loans.name: Delio Ermel

texts.es:
Delio tienen 67 años es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos tiene cinco hijos. Vive en Chillanes Provincia de Bolivar. 

La VRC VIRGEN DE BAÑOS está formada por en la comunidad mama Sara de Cerritos, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina de la Cooperativa.

Delio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz, mora y frejol, ademas a la crianza de ganado. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, fertilizantes, herbicidas para los cultivos. 

Las compras y las Ventas las realiza en Chillanes. El sueño es tener salud para seguir viviendo, tener una vida mas tranquila, tener una buena producción. Ha enfrentado desafios como la falta de capital para comprar lo necesario para la agricultura.

En el tiempo libre le gusta pasear, visitar a los familiares y fisfrutar de las fiestas de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Delio is 67 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and children. He has five children. He lives in the Chillanes Province of Bolivar.

The VRC Virgen de Baños was formed by the mother community of Sara de Cerritos, at a distance of 30 minutes from the Cooperative’s office.

Delio works in agriculture sowing corn, blackberries, and beans. Furthermore, he raises livestock. He is requesting the loan to buy seeds, urea, fertilizers, and herbicides for his crops.

He buys and sells in Chillanes. His dream is to be healthy to continue living, to have a more tranquil life, and to have a good production. He has faced challenges, such as the lack of capital to buy that which is necessary for agriculture.

In his free time he likes to stroll, visit his family, and enjoy the community festivals.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, fertilizers, and herbicides for his crops.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en: Alberto is a 44-year-old man who works hard for his family. He makes 'amacan' (bamboo matting) for a living. Alberto is from Ubay, Bohol and has been making 'amacan' for 23 years now. He has five children, ages 18-23. Alberto is requesting a loan to buy more bamboo that he can use to make 'amacan'. His income allows him to buy food for his family and he hopes to have a bigger business someday.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo to make matting

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
This is Adelaida. She previously accessed a 40,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more sacks of rice. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would now like to apply for a 50,000 PHP loan to buy more sacks of rice to expand her product inventory. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to cover their daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Adelaida dreams of having an additional business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, a place where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional sacks of rice needed in her business.

loans.name: Wiclife

texts.en:
Wyclife is 40 years old, married, and supports his four children as well as his parents. He has been repairing and selling electronic gadgets for a period of about seven years with an income of KES. 34,000 a month.


He is taking out his second loan in KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous one. He wants to use the loan to buy television sets for sale. He hopes to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy television sets for sale.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
This is Narcisa. She previously accessed a 35,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would now like to apply for a 50,000 PHP for her to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Narcisa dreams that her business will be more successful. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy clothing, footwear, cosmetics and other products for her business.

loans.name: Bill

texts.es: Bill, de 31 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres y sus tres hermanos menores.Bill se dedica a la elaboración de panes de la mejor calidad, para  lo cual cuenta con un espacio en la casa de sus padres donde tiene los implementos necesarios para esta preparación tales como ,un horno moderno rotativo, amasadora y demás utensilios que le permiten desarrollar muy bien su trabajo. Lleva en esta actividad 4 años y en todo este tiempo a logrado consolidar una buena clientela gracias a la calidad y el buen sabor de sus panes. Trabaja con el apoyo de un maestro panadero y dos ayudantes para la elaboración y el reparto de sus productos a las bodegas de la zona.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es la idea de poder realizarse como un empresario emprendedor, dar trabajo a otras personas y ayudar a su localidad, comenta que tiene otras ideas de negocio como abrir una chupetería (helados con sabores de frutas de la región), ya que el clima de la región es favorable, mientras tanto continúa cumpliendo su labor actual con mucho entusiasmo.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/ 600 soles y se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Con el préstamo solicitado comprará insumos para la elaboración de panes principalmente harina y mantequilla al por mayor.
texts.en:
Bill, 31 years old, is single and does not have children. He lives in the home of his parents and his three younger siblings. Bill works in the production of bread of the best quality. For this, he counts on a space in the home of his parents where he has the necessary implements for this preparation, such as a modern rotating oven, kneading machine, and other utensils that allow him to develop his business very well. 

He has worked in this activity for four years, and all of this time he has managed to consolidate a good clientele, thanks to his breads’ quality and good flavor. He works with the support of a master baker and two helpers for the production and distribution of his products to the grocery stores in the region. What he likes about his work is the idea of being able to become an entrepreneurial business owner, give work to other people, and help his locality. He comments that he has other ideas for businesses, such as opening an ice cream shop (ice creams with flavors from regional fruit), since the climate of the region is favorable for this. Meanwhile, he continues fulfilling his current work with much enthusiasm. 

In this opportunity, he will request 600 Nuevo Soles and he promises to be punctual with his payments. With the requested loan, he will buy supplies for the production of bread, mainly flour and butter wholesale.

loans.use: to buy flour and butter wholesale.

loans.name: Fedila

texts.en:
Fedila is a 37-year-old married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She has six children. The youngest child is three while the oldest is 15. She owns and operates a retail store selling items like sugar, cooking oil, noodles, beverages and soft drinks. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy more merchandise  like canned goods, condiments and beverages. 

In the future, Fedila would like to expand her business to support her family as well as send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise like canned goods, condiments and  beverages

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Battambang province, Oun is 30 years old and married. She has two children to care for as they are still in school. For her, rice farming on a one hectare area and cow raising, which she has been doing for four years, are the main source of the family’s income. 

With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), she is a fourth cycle borrower requesting 600,000 KHR, whereas her joint member, in the same group of two, is requesting 1,000,000 KHR. The past loans that Oun has repaid back fully and on time have supported her lifestyle and her business. 

As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to purchase potash and rice seed, and to plow her farmland. She hopes this loan will support her rice cropping business on time and return her a good income. She wants to set aside some money to buy a mini-tractor to support her farmland.

loans.use: To purchase potash and rice seed, and to plow her farmland.

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita is a 57-year-old married woman and a mother of six grown up children from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for more than 25 years now. She also runs a sari-sari or variety store selling various goods and items to the people in her village.

She is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets, and also additional groceries for her store, like canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries. In the future, Marianita hopes to make their businesses successful.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets, and also additional groceries for her store, like canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is a 37-year-old single woman, who has worked in car rental for 10 years. Her business is highly requested in Lebanon since tourists come and request such a service in order to have a wide experience in discovering Lebanon on their own. 

Ghada is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner Al Majmoua in order to start a new business. She will start selling car spare parts as an additional income business. Such a business is specialized for men in Lebanon, but she is intending to take the challenge. 

Ghada is enjoying her work, she puts so much effort to develop it and increase her income. She hopes to open a wide spare parts shop in the future and expand her products capital.

loans.use: to start a new business selling spare car parts

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a 31-year-old married woman and a mother of four young children from Getafe, Bohol. Janet has operated a tricycle transport business with her husband for more than 10 years now. She is also in a hog-raising business. Janet is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for the tricycle like wheel, tire, nuts and bolts and also for piglets to raise. Janet hopes of expanding their business in the future so that it will generate more revenue for their needs and expenses, like for the schooling of their children.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the tricycle like wheel, tire, nuts and bolts and also piglets to raise

loans.name: Tiem

texts.en:
Residing in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Tiem is 36 years old and a rice grower in the local area. She has struggled to make a living through her current business as a farmer in order to support her family, especially her two children, one who goes to school and a little kid who is too young for schooling. Tiem is able to generate about 48,000 KHR per day from the current business that she has had for ages. 

Tiem is a fifth-cycle client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and has repaid her past loans completely. She feels confident that she can improve her lifestyle in a gradual manner. Now, her newly requested loan amount is 3,200,000 KHR. She will use this loan to add to her savings in order to buy an additional plot of farmland to grow more crops. She hopes that she can enlarge her business and get a doubled rice crop so that she can earn more income.

loans.use: To buy an additional plot of farmland to grow more crops.

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius is a man of forty years, married to Consolata, and a father of four children. He sells raw, fresh maize in bulk and also sells roasted maize in Kangemi. He has been in this business for 11 years now. Pius gets a monthly income of 15,000 shillings.

This will be Pius' first loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to buy maize in bulk. In the future, he wants to educate his children and also expand his business.

loans.use: To buy fresh maize for resale

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a single mother of two children, both of whom are attending school. She has no additional family members. Juliet operates a beauty salon and works 7 days a week. She has run her business for 5 years.

Juliet has applied for 400,000 UGX to enable her to buy additional hair cosmetics, cream relaxers, Vaseline and braids. She has no other source of income. The main business challenges for her business are seasonality and on-and-off electricity. Her goals and aspirations include expanding her business into a bridal salon and also build her own house. She rents a house she stays in. She has access to electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more hair oil, cosmetics, cream relaxers, Vaseline and braids

loans.name: Sahro

texts.ru: Сахро молодой, трудолюбивый и жизнерадостный парень в возрасте 27 лет. Он женат и имеет двоих прекрасных детей. Сахро после окончания школы, в связи с финансовыми трудностями, не смог поступить в Высшее учебное заведение, чтобы получить высшее образование. Но он закончил курсы вождения грузовой автомашины и получил удостоверение. Вот уже как 2 года он работает таксистом грузовой автомашины и получает доход от своего бизнеса. На полученный доход от своего бизнеса он осуществляет многие свои мечты, помогает своим родителям и содержит свою семью. Ему даже удалось построить для своей семьи новый дом, с лучшими условиями для жизни. У Сахро также есть брат, который планирует скоро жениться, но для этого нужно заработать большую сумму денег. Сахро конечно покроет некоторые расходы свадьбы, но ещё нужны дополнительные денежные средства. Поэтому Сахро решил отправить своего брата в Россию на заработки. В России у них также работает дядя, который поможет найти хорошую работу. Сейчас Сахро обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит для покупки авиабилетов брату  для поездки в Россию. Он очень надеется на положительное решение и заранее благодарит Арванд.
texts.en:
Sahro is a young, hardworking, and cheerful young man of 27 years.  He is married and has two wonderful children.  After finishing school, Sahro was not able to go on to get a higher education because of financial difficulties.  However, he did finish a course, and received certification, in driving cargo vehicles.  For two years now he has had a business working as a commercial driver and earns an income.  His income has enabled him to make many of his dreams come true, like helping his parents and supporting his own family.  He was even able to build his family a new house with all the best conditions for living.

Sahro also has a brother who is planning to marry soon, but he first needs to earn a large amount of money.  Of course, Sahro is going to cover some of the wedding expenses, but they will need money in addition to this.  So, Sahro has decided to send his brother to Russia where he will be able to work and earn money.  They have an uncle who works in Russia and who will help him find a good job.

Now, Sahro has applied to MDO Arvand for a loan to buy airline tickets to Russia for his brother.  He is hoping for a positive decision and thanks MDO Arvand in advance.

loans.use: to buy airline tickets

loans.name: Keur Ale Marame Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc villageois de Keur Alé Marame est créé depuis le 19 septembre 2012, 36 femmes forme le groupe   s'activent dans le commerce, l’élevage et l'agriculture. Fatou est la responsable est âgée de 36 ans. Mariée elle est mère de 02garçons . Elle mène une activité d'embouche ovine .
Elle a une bonne expérience de plus de 5 ans. 
Sur la photo elle est à droite levant sa main gauche. 
Avec son prêt elle compte acheter 3 moutons.
Elle appui la famille dans la nourriture,la santé,et compte refectionner sa chambre
texts.en: The Keur Ale Marame Village Bank was created on September 19, 2012.  36 women form this group that engages in business, animal husbandry, and agriculture.  Fatou is the manager and she is 36-years old. She is married and mother of two sons.  She runs a sheep fattening business. She has over five years of solid experience.  In the photo, she is on the right with her left hand raised.  With her loan, she plans to buy three sheep. She supports her family's nutrition and health and she plans to repair her room.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Karoti Group

texts.en:
Dafrosa, who is in her early 40s, is a married woman with four children, a boy and three girls, who still attend school. With the experience of five years now, Dafrosa has been running different projects: a food shop selling foods like rice, beans, sugar, maize flour, etc., a soft drinks business, a clothes business and a telephone money transfer service (M-pesa). She works from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and she is able to make a good profit per month.

This will be her 13th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans – all which she paid back successfully – she opened the clothes business, restocked on food shop items and started the telephone money-transfer project (M-pesa). With the interest earned, she paid school fees and household expenses, repaired the house and bought a plot where she expects to start some agricultural activities. She will use this loan to restock all her businesses in accordance. She dreams to one day be able to make a big investment on her plot and build a nice house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Karoti" which totals 13 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock all her businesses  .

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.ru: Нилуфар 22 года. Она замужем, но не имеет детей. Благодаря родителям она окончила Медицинский Колледж, и данное время она работает медсестрой в местной больнице. Она очень любит свою работу и с удовольствием выполняет свои функции. Она в феврале текущего года вышла замуж. Ее муж очень хороший человек, но не имеет постоянное место работы. Нилуфару очень тяжело справляться со всеми расходами самой, так как она получает не большую зарплату. Муж Нилуфара попросил ее купить авиабилет для того, чтобы поехать за границу и начать бизнес. Нилуфар не имеет денег и поэтому обратилась за займом. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США для покупки авиабилета. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Nilufar is 22 years old and married, but she and her husband don't have children.  Thanks to her parents, she went to a medical college and she now is working as a nurse in the local hospital.  She loves her job very much and performs it with pleasure.  

She married in February of this year.  Her husband is a very good man, but he doesn't have stable work.  Nilufar earns a modest salary and it is very difficult for her to cover all their expenses by herself.  Nilufar's husband asked her to buy him an airline ticket so he can go abroad to start a business.  Nilufar has applied for a loan because she doesn't have the money herself.  She is requesting a loan of $1000 USD for the purchase of an airline ticket.  She is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy an airline ticket for her husband

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She has had a convenience store since seven years ago. She is a Palestinian refugee living in a Palestinian camp. She works for her family’s living, because her husband doesn’t work all the time, and she has to make sure that they get the necessary standard of living.
 
Sanaa is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner Al Majmoua in order to pay for what is left from her house’s price; she already paid the requested amount from her business income gradually, but today her family’s needs are increasing, and she has to manage business development, the family’s needs and the house at the same time.

She hopes that the future loan will be invested in increasing her business capital and moving to a wider store.

loans.use: to pay for what is left from her house’s price.

loans.name: Keur Ale Marame Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc villageois de Keur Alé Marame est créé depuis le 19 septembre 2012, 36 femmes issues de différentes village (5) constituent le groupe et s'activent dans le commerce, l’élevage et l'agriculture.

Fama présidente du BV est la responsable est âgée de 36 ans.

Mariée elle est mère de 05 enfants dont 03 garçons.

Elle mène une activité d'embouche ovine en même temps que la vente de poisson.

Elle a une bonne expérience de plus de 3 ans et maîtrise bien son domaine car tout le village n'attendent que son poison pour les repas.

Sur la photo elle est à droite levant sa main gauche. 

Avec son prêt elle compte acheter 3 moutons de 22500 F l'un pour embouche à revendre dans quelque mois, aussi tous les jours elle achète du poisson pour une valeur de 12500 qu'elle revend dans son village.

Elle appui la famille dans la nourriture,la santé,la scolarisation et la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en: The Keur Ale Marame Village Bank was created on September 19, 2012. 36 women from five different villages form the group and they are active in business, animal husbandry, and agriculture.  Fama is president of the Village Bank. She is the manager and 36-years old. She is married and mother of five children, three of which are boys.  She is in the business of sheep fattening and the sale of fish at the same time.  She has over three years of solid experience and is an expert in her domain because the whole village only waits for her fish for their meals.  In the photo, she is on the right with her left hand raised.  With her loan, she plans to buy three sheep for 22500 francs, one to fatten for resale in a few months.  She also buys fish every day worth 12500 francs that she resells in her village.  She supports her family's nutrition, health, education, and daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy sheep and fish.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.en:
Elisabeth is a woman of 36 years. She is married to James and a mother of five children who are all in school. She sells fish in Kangemi and has been in this business for 18 years. She gets a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings.

This will be Elisabeth's first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the loan to buy fish in bulk for sale, and in the future, she wants to expand the business and also educate her children.

loans.use: To buy fish in bulk.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice used her previous loan to buy chairs and paint for the hotel that she runs. She is a forty-year-old married woman with four children, living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the hotel business for seven years and with her income she has been able to pay the school fees of her children. Her challenges include price fluctuations, inflation and customers not paying on time. Joice's personal goals are educating her children and building a permanent house for her family; her business goals are to diversify the business to include a piggery, to hire employees to help expand the business and to expand to new markets. Joice intends to use the loan to buy food to sell in her hotel.

loans.use: to buy food for the hotel she runs.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with two children in school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over three years, she has operated a food stall business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. In addition she also owns rental houses, which provide her another source of income. She faces the challenge of price fluctuations in her business. 

With the loan that she is requesting, Fatuma wants to purchase iron sheets and nails, and to pay for the labor needed to furnish her rental houses. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and labor for furnishing her rental houses.

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en:
Ziad is 39 years old and a single man. He has completed secondary school, and is living in a poor area in Taiz. 

His house is very old and in a miserable situation. He has accumulated some money to renovate his house. It is known that house renovation needs a lot of money. He has started renovating his house, but now he is short of money. He needs to complete the renovation task, so he asked for a loan of 500,000 YER (Yemen rials) to buy cement and carpentry help. He hopes that after the completion of the house renovation, he will start accumulating money to improve the life conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy cement and carpentry help for a renovation to his old and miserable house.

loans.name: Nbn Group

texts.en:
Nour is the featured borrower of the N.B.N group; she got with the other group members to apply for a loan from Kiva’s partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Nour is a 20-year-old single woman who works as a tutor to make her living. She is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner Al Majmoua in order to buy household appliances for her future marriage house. She is so excited to buy these items because she is dreaming of her house and about the day she gets married. Nour is the one in the middle.

Bahiya is a married woman and a mother of four children; she has worked in a travel agency since four years ago. She will invest the loan in buying a living room for her house. She hopes to open her own business in the future to improve her income. She is the first from the left.

Nadia is a single woman; she has worked as a tutor since three years ago. With the loan, she will buy a washing machine for her house needs. She is the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy household appliances for her future marriage house.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children; both of them are attending school. She has no additional family members.

Florence owns a retail shop and works for seven days in a week. She has run her business for 20 years. Florence has applied for 500,000 Uganda shillings to enable her to buy bags of sugar and rice, cartons of salt and boxes of soap. She has no other source of income. 

The main business challenges for her business are transportation and the ever increasing prices of commodities in Uganda. Her goals and aspirations include expanding her business to a supermarket. She owns the house she stays in. She has no access to electricity and no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar and rice, boxes of soap and cartons of salt.

loans.name: María Liliana

texts.es: María es una joven de 29 años de edad, quien aprendió a laborar desde muy joven debido a la difícil condición económica de su familia. Gracias a su padre, quien tenía una legumbrería aprendió del oficio y hoy se dedica a la misma actividad. Desde hace cinco años tiene su propio negocio, el cual le permite generar el sustento para ella y su madre. Sueña con expandir su legumbrería y abrir nuevas sedes, brindándoles a otras personas la oportunidad de emplearse. En búsqueda de su sueño, esta mujer se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una nevera, estantería, frutas y hortalizas. Considera que con esta inversión mejorará un nivel de ventas y la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
María is a young woman who is 29 years of age. She learned how to work from a very young age due to her family’s difficult financial situation. Thanks to her father, who owned a legume stand, María learned his trade and is now in the same line of work. She has managed her own business for five years and this enables her to support herself and her mother. María dreams of expanding her business and opening new locations since this will provide other people with the opportunity to work.

In order to pursue this dream, María is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of a cooler, shelving, fruits, and vegetables. She believes this investment will improve her level of sales and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a cooler, shelving, fruits, and vegetables.

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Eliana, quien con su credikiva anterior, compró verduras, como tomate, cebolla, zanahoria, pepinos y habichuelas frescas y una carreta para transportarlos a sus clientes,  con esta inversión atrajo muchos mas compradores y disminuyó el gasto por transporte, por eso aumentaron sus ganancias. En la actualidad como se han aumentado sus ganancias, puede apoyar más a sus 4 hijos. Ella envía a sus financiadores de Kiva  el siguiente mensaje: “Gracias por el apoyo y confianza que depositaron en mi cuando me otorgaron ese crédito.“  En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará   papa  y verduras, que son los productos de mayor demanda y que proyectan generar nuevos ingresos por concepto de sus ventas inmediatas.
texts.en:
Thanks to the support of her previous Kiva loan, Eliana purchased vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, carrots, cucumbers, fresh green beans, as well as a cart for transporting these products to her customers. With this investment, she was able to attract more buyers and reduce the cost of transportation, which increased her earnings. At the moment, Eliana is able to provide more support for her four children with the added income. She sends the following message to the Kiva lenders: “Thank you for the support and the trust you have shown to me by providing this loan.”

Eliana is now applying for another Kiva loan so that she can buy potatoes and vegetables since these products are in great demand. She expects these products to generate immediate sales, which will result in more income.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.
For over three years, she has sold shoes, selling at the market to women and men. She says that her challenge is the high cost of purchasing her products. Mwanamisi dreams of expanding her business to sell wholesale to earn a larger income.
With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase more shoes. 
She decided to join Yehu to access loans, allowing her to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase shoes.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is 59 years old and married. She has 4 children and lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a farmer.
She has run a sewing shop in her home for ten years. She intends to use her loan to buy fabric and sewing tools to provide better quality products for her customers.
She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fabric and sewing tools.

loans.name: Octavila

texts.es:
Doña Octavila es una mujer luchadora, emprendedora de 71 años y que a pesar de su edad ella no deja de soñar en grande, ella es maestra de educación jubilada, soltera y con hijos ya mayores de edad cada quien con su familia y apartado en hogar. Ella se dedica a la agricultura hace muchos años ya que esta actividad ha sido medio de sustento para su familia y lo sigue siendo para ella hoy en día con la ayuda de sus hijos que contribuyen a dar el mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café como: poda, limpieza, corte y fertilización del mismo. Su producto es comercializado y vendido en los alrededores de su hogar con algunos vecinos, personas que lo comercializa en pequeña escala en el mercado local y otros. Sus cultivos están ubicados a 30 minutos de su casa de habitación al cual se transporta en vehículo propio.

Doña Octavila solicita ayuda para poder comprar fertilizantes, abono, plaguicidas, y una bomba de fumigación para su cultivo de café, ya que hoy en día esta clase de productos son caros y la (roya) que es un hongo dañino de no ser tratado a tiempo contamina y daña una cosecha completa.

Sus planes a futuro es tener una amplia plantación de café la cual pueda seguirles dando bendiciones, sustento familiar y pueda ser trabajada de generación en generación por sus hijos, sus nietos, y las próximas generaciones como hasta el día de hoy se hace formando un patrimonio familiar.
texts.en:
Octavila, 71, is an enterprising woman who strives and doesn't stop dreaming big despite her age.  A retired teacher, she's single and has grown children, all with their families and away from home.

She has made a living in agriculture for many years because this work was her means of support for her family and it continues being hers today.  She has the help of her children, who help maintain her coffee crops with pruning, weeding, cutting, and fertilizing.

She markets and sells her product around her home to some neighbors, people who sell it retail in the local market.  Her crops are located 30 minutes from her house; she gets there in her own vehicle.

Octavila's requesting help to be able to buy fertilizer, soil amendments, pesticide, and a fumigation bomb for her coffee crop.  These products are expensive these days and the harmful roya fungus contaminates and damages an entire crop if not treated in time.

Her future plans are to have an extensive coffee farm that will continue to be a blessing that can support her family and be worked through the generations by her children, grandchildren, and the next generations, just as up to the present it is becoming a family asset.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, soil amendments, pesticide, and a fumigation bomb

loans.name: Robinson Arley

texts.es:
Robinsón de 27 años de edad, es un joven amante a su familia y a su trabajo, aprendió el oficio de barbería gracias a sus amigos que le enseñaron, Apasionado por la actividad y con la necesidad de comenzar a generar ingresos para colaborarle a su familia con los gastos del hogar, decidió abrir una barbería en un local que le facilitó su madre. Hoy lleva cinco años desarrollando la actividad y se siente satisfecho por los logros alcanzados.
Se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de insumos (guantes, peines, máquina  de afeitar) y adecuaciones locativas, con el fin de atraer nueva clientela y mejorar la calidad en el servicio. Espera seguir creciendo y convertir su negocio en el más reconocido del sector.
texts.en:
Robinsón, age 27, is a young man who loves his family and his work. He learned how to be a barber from his friends who taught him this trade. Robinsón is passionate about his work and needs to start generating income so that he can help his family with the household expenses. He decided to open a barber shop in a location that was obtained by his mother. Robinsón has been a barber for five years and is satisfied with what he has achieved.

He is requesting a loan so that he can invest in the purchase of supplies such as gloves, combs, and clippers, as well as make structural improvements to his shop, which will attract new clients and improve the quality of his service. Robinsón hopes to keep growing and turn his business into the most recognized establishment in the area.

loans.use: to buy gloves, combs, clippers, and to pay for structural improvements to his shop.

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Sabah is a 52-year-old married woman and a mother of one child. She has been preparing the delicious, traditional Lebanese Breakfast Mankousheh (dough with several different toppings such as thyme, cheese or meat served folded) for twenty years. Eight years ago she started her own business to improve her family’s living conditions. 

Her son is her life; she is sacrificing her whole life for his education and responding to his needs. She is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua, in order to pay for his university fees. 

Sabah is well-known in her region due to the special taste of her products (they are baked over a burning wood-oven). Her Mankousheh is highly requested by customers and recommended to other to try.

She hopes to keep on developing her business in a good way and responding to her customers' needs.

loans.use: To pay for her son's university fees

loans.name: Martina

texts.es: Martina nació en la comunidad de Cuyo Grande (Pisaq, Cusco, Perú) pero vive en la comunidad de Jajahuana. (La comunidad de Jajahuana está ubicado en el distrito de Challabamba dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 36 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene seis hijos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal Santa Isabel de Jajahuana porque es una persona responsable y emprendedora entonces sus actividad económicas son la agricultura, la ganadería y a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como cuyes y gallinas.
texts.en:
Martina was born in the community of Cuyo Grande (which is in Pisaq, Cusco, Peru), but now lives in the community of Jajahuana. The community of Jajahuana is located in the District of Challabamba in Paucartambo Province, Department of Cusco, Peru.

Martina is 36 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has six children. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Santa Isabel de Jajahuana” because she is a responsible and enterprising person. Her business activities include farming, breeding cattle, and raising small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Al Hourriya Group

texts.en:
Huda is the featured borrower of Al Hourriya Group. She is the first one from the right. She got together with the other group members to apply for a loan from Kiva’s partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Huda is a 34-year-old married woman, the mother of two children: Saiid, her 8-year-old son, and Ghalia, her 7-year-old daughter. She works at selling beauty cosmetics, perfumes and cleaning detergents to help her husband make their living. She started her business three years ago. She will invest this loan in increasing her beauty cosmetics with special spring- and summer-released products. She is working hard to help her husband cover their family’s expenses and reply to her children's needs.

Racha is a 22-year-old married woman. She has been working as an accountant since four years ago. She is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner Al Majmoua in order to buy a bedroom for her house. She is the first from the left.

Ayat is a 23-year-old single woman who is working to pay for her university fees. She will invest the requested loan to pay for her university fees. She is the second from the left.

Darine is a 33-year-old married woman, the mother of two children: Mira, her 6-year-old daughter, and Mohamad Husein, her 1.5-year-old son. She has been selling clothes for four years. Her loan is going to be invested in increasing her capital with a spring-summer collection. She hopes that she can open her own shop in the future. She is the second from the right.

loans.use: to increase her beauty cosmetics with special spring- and summer-released products

loans.name: Bienvinida

texts.en:
Bienvinida is 46 years old and married with two children.

Bienvinida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like canned goods, noodles, sugar, snack foods, spices and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Bienvinida has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 5 years and also earns an additional income from manicure/pedicure services.

Bienvinida aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy more items like canned goods, noodles, sugar, snack foods and other groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
Ofelia de 60 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogo, actividad que realiza desde hace tres años desde su hogar, lo que el permite estar pendiente de su hijo quien padece de una enfermedad mental y física. 
Ofelia se siente agradecida con Dios por regarle una fuente de ingresos, debido a que por su condición de madre soltera le ha tocado luchar y guerrearse la vida para sostener a su familia.
Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de mercancía con el fin de incrementar sus ventas y generar los ingresos que necesita par el tratamiento de su hijo.
texts.en:
Ofelia, age 60, sells products through catalogs. She has been in business for three years and is able to work from home. This allows her to be near her son, who suffers from mental and physical illnesses.

Ofelia is thankful to God for giving her a source of income. Being a single mother, she has had to fight and struggle through life in order to support her family. Today she is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of merchandise. This will increase her sales and generate the income she needs for her son’s treatment.

loans.use: to buy beauty and personal use products to sell.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married woman with two school-going children. She lives in her own house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For over eight years, she has operated a retail shop selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of competition from other retail shop operators in her business. With this 50,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, cooking fat oil and washing detergents. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, cooking fat oil and washing detergents.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Aba is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling wood for building and furniture in Enyan Apaa, near Cape Coast. She has been involved in this enterprise for four years.

Aba is married and has four children. Her husband works as a wood machine operator. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees.

Aba wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of wood. In the long term, Aba plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of wood.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor, de 45 años de edad , es madre de dos hijos, uno de ellos ya es mayor de edad mientras que el último aun depende de su cuidado y protección para seguir adelante, vive en su casa propia desde donde lucha continuamente para mejorar su nivel de vida.Flor tiene como trabajo la confección de prendas de vestir con telas de licra y algodón. Ella ha establecido poco a poco su pequeño pero muy productivo taller en su casa en donde diseña y refacciona diferentes prendas de vestir. Cuenta que hace tiempo era trabajadora de una señora que distribuía sus prendas de vestir en un conocido centro comercial de la ciudad, pero con el paso de los años se dio cuenta que ella también podría realizar sus propios diseños y es así como emprendió esta nueva etapa. Trabaja ya 5 años en este negocio y desde que empezó se ha mantenido estable.Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que todos los días su dinero esta en movimiento y eso genera ingresos diarios, además de disponer de su tiempo, esta muy contenta con los créditos obtenidos en MFP por que dice que son muy bajos en cuanto al interés. Le gustaría mas adelante poder tener un taller mas amplio y poder contratar a alguna señora que le pueda ayudar.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 600 soles, está muy agradecida ya que empezó tan solo con una maquina y ahora tiene dos remalladotas y dos maquinas de coser.Con el monto solicitado comprará telas, hilos y elásticos que usa en su trabajo diario.
texts.en: Flor is 45 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is an adult, while the other is still dependent on her for care and support.  She lives in a home of her own where she constantly works to improve her life.  Flor makes clothing out of lycra and cotton fabric.  She has set up her small but productive workshop little by little in her home.  She designs and makes different articles of clothing.  She tells us that some time ago she worked for another woman who distributed her clothing in a well-known shopping center, but over the years she realized that she could also make her own designs and this is how she began this new phase of her business.  She has already worked in this business for five years and it has remained stable.  What she enjoys the most is that her money moves daily and this generates profit.  Aside from giving her time, she is also happy with the loans she has gotten through MFP because she says that the interest rates are very low.  She would like to have a larger workshop in the future and be able to hire another woman to help her.  On this occasion she is requesting a loan in the amount of 600 PEN.  She is very grateful because she started out with just one sewing machine and now she has two loopers and two machines.  She will use the money from this loan to buy fabric, thread, and elastic in order to do her daily work.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Llerme

texts.es:
Llerme, de 48 años, esta casada y tiene una hija de 10 años de edad con quien vive en su casa propia.El trabajo de Llerme consiste en el corte y confección de prendas de vestir, muchas veces refacciona prendas dañadas o en ocasiones espera a que el cliente le de un diseño personalizado, en otras oportunidades ella misma se inspira en nuevas creaciones y elabora sus propias prendas en el que destaca su estilo personal, además de confeccionar prendas de vestir, también se dedica a confeccionar prendas íntimas de lencería como calzones y calzoncillos para venderlas entre sus clientes, familiares y amigos. Su taller está ubicado en su casa en donde acondicionó un lugar para trabajar tranquila. Lleva realizando este negocio por 5 años y con el tiempo aprendió a darle un buen acabado a su trabajo. Anteriormente trabajaba brindando su mano de obra en una pequeña empresa, pero decidió emprender ella misma su negocio y aplicar toda la experiencia que ha logrado durante su vida laboral como costurera.Le gusta lo que hace porque labora de manera independiente, tiene su propio horario de trabajo y además le brinda a otras personas la oportunidad de laborar ya que en ciertas temporadas contrata personal cuando tiene demasiados pedidos y no se abastece ella sola, asegura que la decisión que tomó fue la más acertada ya que eso se refleja en los ingresos que ahora percibe. Desea continuar realizando su trabajo y más adelante tener un taller más grande con más máquinas y más trabajadores.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500 soles, por ello agradece a las personas que hacen posible su crédito y le dan la oportunidad de continuar trabajando para lograr sus objetivos.
Con el monto solicitado comprará materiales como hilos, agujas, botones, telas, forros y blondas para continuar confeccionando las prendas de vestir que pone a la venta.
texts.en:
Llerme is 48 years old, married, and has one daughter who is 10 years old. They live together in their own home. Llerme works as a tailor. Often she works repairing damaged garments, on occasion she accepts personalized designs from customers, and in other instances she herself gets inspired to create new designs and makes her own garments highlighting her own personal style. In addition to making clothing, Llerme also works making undergarments and intimate wear which she sells to her customers, relatives, and friends. Her workshop is located in her home where she added a room where she can work quietly. She has been managing this business for five years and in this time has learned to apply excellent craftsmanship to her work. Previously she worked for a small company, but she decided to start her own business and apply all of her experience she had earned during her time working as a seamstress. She likes what she does because she can work independently, she can set her own hours, and she also has the opportunity to employ other people because during certain seasons she contracts out to others when she has too many orders for her to fill by herself. She is sure the decision she made was the right one, as reflected in the income she now makes. She wishes to continue doing her work and later to have a bigger workshop with more machines and more workers. 

In this cycle she is requesting S/. 1500 soles. She is grateful to the donors who make this loan possible and give her the opportunity to continue working to achieve her goals. With the requested amount she will purchase materials such as threads, needles, buttons, fabrics, linings and laces to continue producing the garments which she sells.

loans.use: purchase clothing materials such as fabric, threads, and other items.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 36-year-old married man and a father to two sons and two daughters. He lives with his family in Ya'abad Village near Jenin, which is famous for its crops. Khaled is employed and has a small salary, which is not really enough to cover all the family's needs.

For the past three years, Khaled has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and a helpful source of income for the family. Khaled is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of licensing and insuring the taxi he drives. This will enable Khaled to travel freely from one area to another and to take additional internal and external requests, which will positively improve the family's income.

Khaled is photographed next to his taxi.

loans.use: To insure and license the taxi.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
This is Mercedes. Her previous loan was a big help to her business. She was able to buy the spare parts needed for her tricycle unit. The loan also helped in the education of her children. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their family.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of the tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain the family's daily needs and children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mercedes hopes that her children will finish their education up to the college level and dreams of having more vehicles. She meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners and/or clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance for her tricycle (motorcycle).

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael is a single, 24-year-old young man. He is employed and earns a low salary which is not enough to cover all of his needs.

For the past three months, Ismael has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and a second source of income for him.

Ismael is requesting a USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new engine for the taxi he drives. This will increase the taxi's capabilities, allowing Ismael to work extra hours and enabling him to take additional internal and external requests, which will positively improve his income and ensure a better future for him.

Ismael is pictured next to his taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a new engine for his taxi.

loans.name: Abdelazeez

texts.en:
AbdelAzeez is a single, 25-year-old young man who lives with his family in Biet Lahia refugee camp near Jabalia.

For the past two years, AbdelAzeez has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income for him.

AbdelAzeez is requesting a $2,000 youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new engine and new mats for the taxi he drives. This will improve the taxi's condition and increase its capacity to work extra hours, enabling AbdelAzeez to take additional internal and external requests, which will positively improve his income and ensure a bright future for him.

AbdelAzeez is photographed next to his taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a new engine and install new mats in his taxi.

loans.name: Jestoni

texts.en:
Jestoni is a fisherman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. Jestoni is a married man and has been in the business for more than three years now. This is his source of income.

Jestoni is asking for a loan to buy fuel for the boat and to pay for the repair and maintenance of the boat. Jestoni hopes to make his business sustainable and successful.

loans.use: to buy fuel for the boat and to pay for the repair and maintenance of the boat.

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es: maria de 34 años de edad vive con sus 2 hijos que estudain actualmente ella se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años su principal siembra es el maiz y el frijol con las ganacias que obtiene de sus ventas ha logrado sacra adelante a sus hijos y cubrir algunos gastos en el hogar, ella solicita un credito que le permita comprar insecticidas y fertilizantes asi como lo muestra en la fotografia y poder seguir teneindo muy buenas cosechas y asi ella podra tener mejores ganancias para seguir dandole lo mejor a su familia
texts.en:
Maria is 34 years old and lives with her two children who are in school. She currently works as a farmer. For the past several years, the main crops she has planted have been corn and beans. With the earnings she generates from her sales, she has been able to help her children get ahead and pay for some of the household expenses.

Maria is requesting a loan so that she can buy insecticides and fertilizers, as indicated by the photograph. This will enable her to have a good harvest, which will generate more profits that will allow her to provide the best for her family.

loans.use: to buy insecticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Efua is an entrepreneur. She prepares and sells ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough wrapped in banana leaves). She can be found selling ‘Kenkey’ in Enyan Apaa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 5 years.

Efua is married and has eight children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her ‘Kenkey’ business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. Efua will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to further diversify the types of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Demetria works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish and bread vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and raising livestock. Demetria is borrowing 19,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish and bread to sell.

Demetria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to achieve her dream of saving enough to buy farmland.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish and bread to sell.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a single mother with four children, three of whom attend school. She has no additional family members. She rents the house she stays in and has access to electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and rent.

Annet sells old clothes in the market on a daily basis. She works six days in a week, and she has run her business for 10 years. Annet has applied for 400,000 Ugandan shillings to enable her to buy additional bales of used clothes. She has no other source of income. The main challenges for her business are seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations include expanding her business into a wholesale and also to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Seynabou's Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc villageois And Suxali Barome est créé depuis le 19 septembre 2012 , il est au cycle 2; il est constitué de 36 femmes issues du même village et elles s'activent dans le commerce et l'agriculture.
Ndoumbé la représentante est âgée de 55 ans,mariée elle est mère d'un enfant.C'est une femme qui a remboursé son prêt sans difficultés, elle mène une activité d'agriculture et cultive particulièrement de l'arachide et fait de l'embouche ovine en même temps. Elle capitalise une bonne expérience de plus de 30 ans et maîtrise bien son domaine car beaucoup de gens dans le village n'attendent que ses produits à cause de leur bonne  qualité.Sur la photo elle est la seule à être debout et a levé la main droite.

Avec son prêt elle compte acheter 3 moutons de 25000 F l'un pour embouche à revendre dans quelque mois.

Elle souhaite atteindre une autonomie financière et assurer les charges familiales.
texts.en:
The banc villageois "And Suxali Barome" was created on September 19, 2012. It is in cycle 2; it is composed of 36 women from the same village, and they are active in commerce and agriculture. 

Ndoumbé, the representative, is 55 years old, married, and the mother of one child. A woman who has paid back her loan without difficulty, she has an agriculture business and grows peanuts in particular, and she fattens sheep at the same time. She capitalizes on over thirty years of good experience and is really mastering her domain, since many people in the village wait for only her products due to the good quality. In the photo, she is the only one standing with her hand raised. 

With her loan, she intends to purchase 3 sheep at 25,000 francs to fatten and resell in a few months. 

She would like to achieve financial autonomy and to ensure family expenses are covered.

loans.use: to purchase sheep to fatten

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Even though Yaa grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family.

Currently, Yaa is an entrepreneur. She prepares and sells ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough wrapped in banana leaves) for a living. She primarily sells her ‘Kenkey’ in Enyan Apaa (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began eight years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their two children.

Yaa has identified the growing demand among consumers for her ‘Kenkey’; nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to a limited inventory capacity. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of maize, therefore helping her to prepare more of her tasty ‘Kenkey’.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Yaa wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all of her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize, therefore helping her to prepare more of her tasty ‘Kenkey’.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is a married woman and a mother of two children from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for more than 10 years now. This is the source of their income.
 
Cristita is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and a flashlight. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and a flashlight

loans.name: Raul Antonio

texts.es: don raul de 45 años de edad vive con su familia en casa propia el tiene un negocio de molino desde hace varios años trabaja todo los dias pues su clientela con las señoras que hacen tortillas porque donde el llegan a moler el maiz para hacerlas, con las ganancias que obtiene logra cubrir algunos gastos, el solicita un credito que le permita comprar discos, ejes y demas herramientas que le permitan tener en buen estado su molino y seguir teniendo mejores ganancias para darle a su familia lo que necesitan sin ninguna limitacion.
texts.en: Raul is 45 years old. He lives with his family in the house that they own. He has had a milling business for several years. He works every day; his customers are the women who make tortillas from the corn they bring him to grind. With the money he earns, he is able to cover some costs. He is requesting a loan that will allow him to buy grinding plates, spindles, and other tools that will allow him to have his mill in good condition and continue to have better earnings so that he can give his family what they need without limitations.

loans.use: to purchase grinding plates, spindles, and tools for his corn mill.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira works hard to support her family. Elmira is married and has a buy and sell of rice grains business in the Philippines.

Elmira requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy more sacks of rice grains to sell.

Elmira has been in this business for three years now.

Elmira would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Las Tejedoras Group

texts.es:
Las 13 integrantes cuentan con actividades comerciales variadas, cada una trabaja para el sustento de sus negocios. En su mayoría, las integrantes de este comité son madres de familia que luchan por dar a sus hijos todo lo que ellos necesitan.
La señora Blanca es integrante  del comité, ella es artesana y empleada, cuenta que por medio de su trabajo ayuda a su familia y les da lo que puede según sus posibilidades. Ella sueña con poder ir creciendo cada día más.
Solicita de este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de  hilos para elaborar ropas artesanales  para su posterior venta, ya que tiene muchos pedidos. Ella comenta que sus prendas son muy solicitadas porque son de muy buena calidad.
texts.en:
All thirteen members have different commercial activities; each one of them works to keep their business afloat. Most of them are parents that struggle to give their children all they need.

Mrs. Blanca is one of the members. She is an artisan an also works as an employee. Blanca says that through her job, she helps her family and gives them what she can. She has a dream: to progress every day more.

Blanca is requesting a loan to buy threads to make handmade clothes to sell; she has many orders. She says that her clothes are popular with customers because they are of very good quality.

loans.use: to buy threads for her handmade clothes.

loans.name: Abene

texts.en: Even though Abene grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for herself and her family. Currently, Abene is an entrepreneur. She prepares and sells kenkey (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough wrapped in banana leaves) for a living. She primarily sells her kenkey in Enyan Apaa, near Cape Coast. Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began four years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their four children. Abene has identified a growing demand among consumers for her kenkey. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to a limited inventory capacity. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of maize, therefore, helping her to prepare more of her tasty kenkey. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abene wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize, therefore, helping her to prepare more of her tasty ‘kenkey’.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 61-year-old man from Eregi in Vihiga County. He supports seven people in his family. He is married to Sophia who is a small-scale farmer and they are blessed with six children who are now grown ups. Their ages are 40, 37, 33, 29, 27 and 23 years old, respectively.

He is a blacksmith, a business he has been doing for 22 years and comfortably makes a monthly income of KES 8,700. He has applied for the second loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase tools like vices and clamps to enable him do his job to the perfect of his knowledge. He will use the anticipated profit to diversify his farm to give more produce.

He has a dream of building a very decent home after retiring from his business and leaving a good legacy to his children and grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase tools like clamps and vices for his business

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 39-year-old married man and a father of four children. Three years ago, he started his business to improve his living and develop his financial situation.

Mohamad is applying for his fourth cycle loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase his business merchandise with special spring and summer beverages in addition to increasing different kinds of cheese to please his customers' needs.

Mohamad is well known in the region with his competitive prices and products. He hopes to start seasonal trade in wholesale to the market.

loans.use: To purchase special spring and summer beverages and different kinds of cheese

loans.name: La Joie Du Christ Group

texts.fr: LA JOIE DU CHRIST est un groupe de deux personnes, dont les membres sont des amies. La représentante du groupe, Cécile Nunvenoumédé est âgée de 36 ans et est mariée à Jean. Cécile Nunvenoumédé a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au niveau secondaire. Le couple n’a pas encore d'enfant. Cécile Nunvenoumédé et son mari vivent ensemble et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Il y a dix ans que Cécile Nunvenoumédé vend des produits cosmétiques et des mèches dans son quartier. Cécile Nunvenoumédé exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins. Cécile Nunvenoumédé s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Cécile Nunvenoumédé sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe LA JOIE DU CHRIST, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Le prêt antérieur à été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
LA JOIE DU CHRIST is a group of two persons whose members are friends. The group's representative, Cécile Nunvenoumédé, is 36 years old and married to Jean, and she has attended secondary school. The couple does not have children yet. Cécile Nunvenoumédé and her husband live together and jointly ensure that the different household expenses are covered. 

For ten years, Cécile Nunvenoumédé has been selling cosmetic products and hair extensions in her district. She operates this business with passion, and this enables her to meet her needs. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customer base, she is requesting, along with the other members of the group LA JOIE DU CHRIST, a second loan from ALIDé. This loan will be use to respond better to the demands of their customers and to make more profit. The previous loan was indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products and hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Esha

texts.en:
Esha is a married woman with two school-going children, who are the reason for her hard work. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past three years, she has operated a business selling charcoal at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the challenge of price fluctuations in her business. Esha dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale in the future.

With this 10,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase eight sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase eight sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Esi did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Esi prepares and sells ‘Banku’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth whitish consistent paste) in her village of Enyan Apaa (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about seven years. She is married to a farmer and together they have five children. Esi uses all of her income to feed and provide for her family. Esi will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of maize and cassava, which will aid her in improving her overall ‘Banku’ sales. Esi wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase maize and cassava

loans.name: Fahd

texts.en: Fahd is a 23-year-old married man with one child. He is very hard working and doing his best to earn money. However, he started his business working with his dad in their grocery store. When his dad felt tired, Fahd became the only breadwinner for his family.  He thinks without sacrifice you can't succeed in your business. He complains that his business is not running well, so he applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy grocery items for his business. He hopes to expand his business to increase his profit.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for his business.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo, 52 años de edad, casado, originario de la comunidad El Riego en las afueras de Teustepe, de oficio agricultor padre de 6 hijos, de los cuales solo 3 estudian los otros son independientes. El aprendió este oficio desde muy pequeño trabajando junto con sus padres y hermanos una parte de la cosecha la vendía y la otra era para el consumo familia, sus primeras siembras fueron chiltoma y cebolla. Actualmente se dedica a la siembra de frijol y maíz, la mayoría de su cosecha la vende en Boaco, su esposa trabaja vendiendo cosa de horno( es un pan hecho a base de maíz dulce , canela y azúcar). 
Requiere el crédito para comprar abonos, fertilizantes, plaguicidas para evitar la propagación de plagas que pueden arruinar la cosecha.  Uno de sus planes futuros es comprar tierra para sembrar hortalizas y tener mas capacidad para producir y mejorar sus ingresos desea que su familia tenga una mejor calidad de vida. Su meta próxima es sacar adelante su producción de frijol de calidad.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is 52 years old, married, and originally from the community of El Riego, which is outside of Teustepe. He is a farmer and the father of six children, three of whom are studying while the rest are independent. Lorenzo learned his trade at a very young age by working with his parents and siblings. Part of the harvest was sold and the rest was used for family consumption. The main crops they grew were bell peppers and onions.

Lorenzo is currently planting beans and corn, most of which will be sold in Boaco. His wife works by selling “cosa de horno” (a bread made from sweet corn, cinnamon, and sugar). He is requesting a loan in order to buy compost, fertilizers, and pesticides to prevent the propagation of pests that could ruin his crops. One of his plans in the future is to buy land for planting vegetables. This will give him more production capacity and improve his earnings so that his family will have a better quality of life. His next goal going forward is to produce quality beans.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, and pesticides.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
From Anda, Bohol, Geraldine, a 31-year-old mother of a five-year-old son, has been raising pigs for five years, earning 3,000 PHP a month. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy feeds and additional pigs in order to sustain her business.

In the future, Geraldine would like to expand to her enterprise so as to better provide for her son's basic needs and save for his education.

loans.use: to buy feeds and additional pigs.

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en:
Estrelita is 54 years old and married with three children.

Estrelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell dry goods business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of dry goods like bags, pants, blouses, etc. to sell.

Estrelita has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell dry goods business for 11 years and earns additional income from her general store.

Estrelita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of dry goods like bags, pants, blouses, etc. to sell

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, Halima has operated a business making fruit juices from home for sale. She faces the challenge of seasonality in fruits. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers’ needs.

With this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase fruit for making fruit juices for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruit for making fruit juices for sale.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Ekua is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling garden eggs in Enyan Apaa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for eight years. Ekua is married and has five children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Ekua will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of garden eggs, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase garden eggs

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Even though Efua grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Efua is an entrepreneur. She sells maize and garden eggs in Enyan Apaa (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began 20 years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their six children. 

Efua has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her product. Nevertheless she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more maize and garden eggs to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more maize and garden eggs to sell.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is 36 years old. He is married to Pamela, who is a business lady and also supports the family financially. They have two children who are three years old and a 9-month-old baby.

Alexander has owned a retail shop since 1998. He earns a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan shillings. He has applied for his first loan with KADET Ltd., which he will use to add more stock of sugar, cooking oil, milk, maize flour and any other shop items. He will use the anticipated profit to grow his business into a wholesale one. He has a dream of making his business become a wholesale so as to earn more income which will eventually help him support his family.

loans.use: to purchase more retail goods like sugar, salt and cooking oil for sale

loans.name: Toufic

texts.en:
Toufic is a 41-year-old married man and the father of three children.

He is a Palestinian refugee living in Lebanon and working as a blacksmith since 13 years ago. Toufic works hard to develop his business; that's why he is applying for his fourth loan cycle from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy a forklift truck that will make his work easier in moving iron pillars from one place to another.

Toufic has a good standing and repayment history. His previous loans helped him a lot in developing his business and improving his family's living conditions.

He hopes to expand his business and be capable of working outside the Palestinian camp he is living in.

loans.use: To buy a forklift truck necessary for his business.

loans.name: La Alegria Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado La Alegria está en su ciclo número uno del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza el cual les ayuda a medir el ingreso de cada una.
Alba es una de las integrantes del grupo, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que se esfuerza por salir adelante y ayudar a su familia.
