El negocio lo inicio con ahorros propios y le ha dado buen resultado. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 8,000 Lempiras para surtir más el negocio con productos como jugos, baterías, carnes, refrescos, frijoles y maíz. Su objetivo es lograr establecer mejor el negocio, comprar varios frízeres para vender carnes y con las ganancias ayudar a su hija con los estudios.
texts.en:
Sulma, 48, is the single mother of three children. She lives in a suburb of San Pedro Sula. She has always been in business and also takes in laundry. A year ago, she decided to open a small store in her house, selling daily consumption items such as beverages, churros, flour, basic grains, sugar, salt, pills, margarine, soap, and toilet paper. She opened the business with her savings, and it has been a success. 

She decided to apply for a loan of 8,000 lempiras to stock her business with items like juice, batteries, meat, beverages, beans, and corn. Her goal is to solidify her business, to buy some freezers so that she can sell meat, and to help her daughter with her education fees.

loans.use: to stock her business with items like juice, batteries, meat, beverages, beans, and corn.

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfred is a 32-year-old married man with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. For three years, he has been running a stationery shop and he also has rental houses. As the good father that he is, he desires to educate his child to attain a master's degree and also to set up sustainable income-generating activities.

Inadequate capital to meet increasing demand is his major challenge while his dream is to open another outlet. Wilfred intends to use the loan to buy books and papers to sell.

loans.use: to buy books and papers to sell.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel, es de la comunidad Las Canoas casado la esposa le tiene 3 hijos de 10, 4 y 3 años de edad, están estudiando la primaria, se dedica a la compra  y venta de lentes de lujo desde hace un año. Inicio trabajando como vocalista de un conjunto musical lo cual lo realizaba en distintos restaurantes de Managua  después decidió  comprar y vender CD de música  también vende lentes. Entre otras actividades que realiza n visita una iglesia donde canta música cristiana. 
Este negocio de venta de anteojos lo realiza de forma ambulante y hoy está solicitando este crédito para  comprar diferentes tipos de lentes de lujos y de medidas para la venta. El  crédito le será de ayuda ya que podrá aumentar un poco más el inventario del negocio y obtener más ganancia y así ir comprando diferentes productos para la venta tales como carteras reloj y gorras.
texts.en:
Manuel lives in Las Canoas, is married, and has three children, ages 10, 4, and 3, who are in elementary school. He has been selling quality sunglasses for a year. His first job was vocalist for a band that played at restaurants in Managua. Then he decided to sell music CDs and glasses. Among other things, he sings Christian music at the church he attends.
 
He sells sunglasses as a street vendor. This loan is to buy a variety of styles and sizes of quality sunglasses to sell. The loan will help him buy a bit more inventory, earn more profit, and buy different items like wallets, watches, and caps to sell.

loans.use: to buy a variety of styles and sizes of quality sunglasses to sell.

loans.name: Marina De Jesus

texts.es:
Marina, se dedica a la siembra de hortaliza y venta de antojitos. Ella es una persona reconocida en la comunidad por ser luchador y responsable en todo, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 18 y 20 año, ellos son los que le ayudan en la actividad que realiza, ya que realiza siembra de maíz, ejotes, y  tomates; asimismo vende antojitos tales como: tamales, enchiladas, entre otros, este trabajo lo lleva a cabo dos días por semana desde por la mañana hasta las 4:00 pm. 
El préstamo que requiere lo invertirá para limpiar dos tareas de terreno para la siembra de tomate y para la compra de insumos agrícolas como: abono, herbicidas, insecticidas y plaguicidas. Este le permitirá  mantener la actividad más rentable e incrementar sus cosechas; uno de los riegos es por la escasez del agua en el verano o una posible plaga en las plantas, también es menos arriesgado en el invierno debido a la abundancia del agua.
Su sueño es aumentar las ganancias para poder invertir  y producir más cosechas; su objetivo es ahorrar para realizar algunas mejoras a la vivienda.
texts.en:
Marina makes a living as a vegetable farmer and small business owner. She is known in her community as a very hardworking, responsible woman who is dedicated to her husband and two children, ages 18 and 20. Her kids help her with the farming of her corn, green beans and tomato crops. Two days a week, from early in the morning until 4:00 in the afternoon, Marina also sells snacks and food items such as tamales, enchiladas and other small dishes. 

With the support from this loan, Marina plans to clear and prepare two parcels of land for planing tomato crops. She also plans to utilize funds for purchasing manure, herbicides, insecticides and pesticides for tending her crops. She hopes that this investment will help make her farming operation more efficient and increase the yield of her harvests. Some of the challenges she faces as a farmer in her region are droughts in the hot, dry summers, as well as pests that affect crops. Her dream is to increase her harvest, sales and overall income so that she can in turn reinvest her profits back into her land and future harvests. She also hopes to save up in order to make some improvements to her home.

loans.use: to clear and prepare two parcels of land for planting her tomato crop, as well as purchase manure, herbicides, insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en: Andrew is a 43-year-old hardworking man with seven children living in Masindi, Uganda. The responsibility for looking after the family rests solely on him. He operates a retail shop; he started the business in order to earn income to meet daily expenses since agriculture is seasonal. His challenges are bad weather and inadequate capital. His dream is to expand his farming activities. Andrew intends to use the loan to buy farm inputs.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a married man with seven children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For over five years, Juma has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) transport business, operating from door to door serving town dwellers and neighbors. He mentioned that during rainy season it becomes hard to operate his business, and hence he earns a low income.

With the requested loan of KES 100,000, Juma wants to purchase two motorcycles for his transport business. He dreams of expanding his business to earn more profits in the future.

loans.use: to purchase two motorcycles for his transport business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to do finishing touches to the exterior of the house

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school. She lives in a rented house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

Fatuma has operated a café for the past four years, selling to town dwellers and passersby. She faces a challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to establish a restaurant in the future.

With the requested loan of KES 20,000, Fatuma wants to purchase potatoes, beans, and cooking oil for her café. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, beans, and cooking oil for her café.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For more than nine years, she has operated a charcoal- and firewood-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is seasonality, especially during rainy season it becomes difficult to operate. 

With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase 10 sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 45-year-old married man with eight children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He grows maize and Irish potatoes.  He has been in farming for eight years.  With his salary savings as a teacher, he decided to buy land for farming and the business is profitable.

Like all good fathers, he desires to educate his children up to the university level.  Unpredictable weather changes and price fluctuations are his major challenges.  His dream is to become a model farmer in the area.  Joseph intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for  his children

loans.name: Abdulrhman

texts.en:
Abdulrhman is a 22-year-old single man. He is an employer. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. 

Abdulrhman starts his job at 7:00 a.m. and finishes at 2:00 p.m. He has a low salary, which is not enough to provide support for his family. He is asking for a youth loan of 100,000 YER to buy furniture for his house. He hopes to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his house.

loans.name: Gardenia

texts.en:
Gardenia is 48 years old and has seven children. Gardenia is married and has one child who is in school.

Gardenia is in the agricultural business, hog raising in the Philippines. Gardenia requested a PHP 15000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation,Inc. to purchase feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs.

Gardenia has been in the hog raising business for 3 years now and has borrowed 5 times in the past from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation,Inc. to sustain it.

In the future, Gardenia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 41 years old and lives in the town of Masidi in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has 8 children, 4 of whom are currently in school. For the past 8 years, Ruth has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells soap, sugar, milk and bread. 

To help expand her business, Ruth has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items such as rice, maize flour and soda to sell, and will help Ruth to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Ruth hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business into a wholesale shop. 

Ruth is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ruth who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as rice, maize flour and soda to sell

loans.name: Sostena

texts.en:
Sostena is now 62 years old, and she is happily living with her family. She is still operating her cereals store, and her monthly income has improved to KES 23,000.

Sostena has borrowed KES 65,000 from KADET LTD, which she intends to use to pay school fees and buy more cereals to sell. The anticipated income from her business will be used to improve the living standards of her family.

Her dream is to see her business expand and to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy more cereals and to pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a 37-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. Together with her husband, she has been in the fishing business for more than 10 years. This is the source of their income.

Salome is asking for a loan to pay for repairs to her fishing boat. The repairs will enable her husband to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Salome hopes to make their fishing venture a success.

loans.use: to pay for repairs to her fishing boat

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.en:
Valeriana is a 58-year-old woman from CPG, Bohol, Philippines. She has run a sari-sari store (general store) business for more than 10 years. She sells canned goods, seasoning, toiletries, chips, and candies. She is married with two grown children, but Valeriana wants to always be productive and earn an income. She is asking for a loan to buy food and gasoline. She hopes that with additional stocks of these goods, she can have a better income. 

In the future, Valeriana hopes to offer more products that she does not carry right now and provide better service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy food and gasoline

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria Elena es nativa de Cardenas, San Luís Potosí, México; estando muy chica sus padres emigraron hacia Torreón, Coahuila, donde pasó su niñez junto con sus 4 hermanos; vivió en esa ciudad durante 15 años, ya que dejó a sus padres para buscar una mejor vida. Llegó a la ciudad de Monterrey, Nuevo León en 1999 y conoció a la persona con quien se contrajo matrimonio, pero 14 años después la abandonó; para entonces contaba con 3 hijos ( 2 varones y una mujer), asumiendo la responsabilidad como madre de sacarlos adelante, por lo que decidió ponerse a trabajar. 

Su primer empleo  fue en una  estética del centro de la ciudad, donde aprendió diferentes formas y estilos de corte de cabello. Para mejorar sus conocimientos de belleza, con esfuerzo combinó su trabajo con sus estudios, inscribiéndose en la Escuela de Artes y Oficios de Nuevo León donde se especializó en Cultora de Belleza. Una de sus maestras la motivó a poner una pequeña peluquería en el garaje de la casa que rentaba atendiendo a todos los clientes que llegaban con ella. Pasó el tiempo y con mucho sacrificio, logró juntar una cantidad de dinero que le permitió comprar la casa donde vive actualmente y como pudo construyó una habitación para poner su estética, la cual llamó Estética Marbella en honor a su hija. 

La Sra. María Elena ya cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes y que día a día se incrementan por la atención y servicio que ella les ofrece con mucha satisfacción. Para ello ha solicitado un crédito que le permitirá adquirir mobiliario y agrandar su negocio, que a su vez le generará mayores ingresos para seguir ayudando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María Elena is from Cardenas, San Luís Potosí, México.  When she was very little her parents immigrated to Torreón, Coahuila.  That is where she spent her childhood with her four siblings.  She lived in the city for 15 years.  She then left her parents in order to look for a better life.

She arrived in the city of Monterrey, Nuevo León, in 1999.  She met the person to whom she was married.  However, 14 years later he abandoned her.  By then she had three children (two boys and a girl).  She took on the responsibility as a mother to get them ahead.  She decided to go to work.

Her first job was in a beauty shop in the center of the city where she learned different ways and styles of cutting hair.  In order to improve her knowledge about beauty, and with effort, she combined her work with her studies.  She enrolled in the Escuela de Artes y Oficios in Nuevo León, where she specialized in beauty services. 

One of her teachers motivated her to set up a small beauty shop in the garage of the house that she was renting.  She tended to all of the customers who came to her.  Time passed, and with great sacrifice, she managed to get together an amount of money that allowed her to buy the house where she now lives.  As she was able, she built a room to set up her beauty shop.  It is called Estética Marbella in honor of her daughter.  

María Elena now has a lot of customers.  This increases day to day because of the attention and service that she offers her customers with great satisfaction.

She has requested a loan that will allow her to get  furnishings and to expand her business.  This will generate greater income for her in order to continue helping her children.

loans.use: to buy furnishings and equipment.

loans.name: Justa

texts.es:
Justa tiene 55 años de edad, pero tiene el carisma de una joven de 20 años. Justa ha atravesado por muchos momentos difíciles, sobre todo cuando su esposo falleció se convirtió en madre y padre de su 7 hijos a los cuales saco adelante  con mucho esfuerzo y por los cuales ha luchado mucho para que tengan sobre todo un buena educación, ya que Justa es analfabeta y por ello se esforzó mucho por darle sus hijos un mejor futuro que el que tuvo ella.

Cada día Justa se levanta muy temprano para dirigirse a su parcela , ya que ella es agricultora, actualmente ha sembrado algodón y ella le dedica  a su cultivo alrededor de 9 horas al día y ella cree que está saliendo adelante cada día porque tiene mucha fe en Dios .

Justa está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes, poder solventar los gastos de riego y arado de su cultivo, así ella podrá tener una mejor cosecha, mejorar sus ingresos y luchar por hacer realidad  uno de sus grandes sueños:” Comprar un carrito  para poder movilizarse a su parcela”.
texts.en:
Justa is 55 years old, but she has the charisma of a 20-year-old young woman. Justa has passed through many difficult times; worst of all when her husband died she became both mother and father to her 7 children. She is getting her children ahead with a lot of effort and she strives so that they will be able to have a good education. Justa is illiterate, so she makes a lot of effort to give her children a better future than the one she had.

Justa gets up very early every day to go to her plot of land, as she is a farmer. At the moment she has planted cotton and she spends nearly 9 hours a day working on her crop. She believes that she is getting ahead every day because she has a lot of faith in God.

Justa is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help they have provided her she will be able to buy fertilizer and to pay the expenses for irrigating and plowing her crop. She will thus be able to have a better crop, improve her income, and strive to make one of her greatest dreams a reality: "To buy a little car to be able to move around her land."

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and irritation, among other things.

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
Ayman is a 41-year-old married man, the father of two children. He has been working in construction since 2000, and he specializes in painting work.

Ayman is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to buy special tools and iron pillars necessary to develop his business. This is his first loan as Al Majmoua borrower, and he hopes that future loans will be invested widely in developing his business.

Ayman works hard to provide his family with the best education and living. He hopes to stay in good health to make sure that he can expand his work to meet his family's and customers' needs.

loans.use: To buy special tools and iron pillars necessary to develop his business

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a woman of sixty seven years. She is married to Samuel and the mother of nine children, two of whom are in secondary school. Hannah buys and sells pigs, and she has been in this business for thirteen years. She earns a monthly income of 9000 KES.

This will be Hannah's second loan with KADET LTD, and she plans to use the entire amount to buy pig feeds. In the future, she wants to educate her children to the university level and also expand her business.

loans.use: To buy pig feeds

loans.name: Milagro De La Paz

texts.es:
Milagro tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos, uno de 10 años y el otro de 12 años. Se dedica al comercio informal de frescos naturales, yuca, panes y otros. Tiene siete años de realizar esta actividad y comenzó en el momento en que su esposo la abandonó para formar otro hogar y ella quedo sola con sus dos hijos pequeños, por lo cual se vio obligada a innovar y buscar algo que le brindara una fuente de ingresos; fue entonces cuando comenzó a realizar ventas para el alimento diario de ella y sus dos hijos, antes de ello se dedicaba únicamente a los oficios domésticos y a cuidar sus hijos, luego todo cambio comenzó a ser papá y mamá para su familia.
Compra los insumos en la ciudad más cercana o en su mismo pueblo; ya que compra solamente en cantidades menores y de esta manera va logrando salir adelante y viendo crecer a su familia.
El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para mejorar su vivienda en la cual ha vivido por muchos años y por falta de recursos económicos no ha podido mejorar, ella comprara ladrillo, cemento y hierro. Así, podrá mejorar su vivienda y vivir de una manera mas digna, saludable y sobre todo segura, ya que por su trabajo se ve obligada a salir y dejar su vivienda. 
Su vida mejora en que ella podrá trabajar sin ningún pensar, también podrá realizar los cambios que con recursos propios es difícil poder realizarlos y su satisfacción personal de poder contribuir como mamá soltera al desarrollo de mejores condiciones.
En el futuro solo piensa en brindar las condiciones a sus hijos de las cuales ella no pudo optar, que sus hijos estudien y en el futuro sean personas de bien en la sociedad.
texts.en:
Milagro, 46, is a single mother of two children, ages 10 and 12.  She makes a living in the informal sector selling naturals drinks, yucca, bread, and other things.  She has done this work for seven years.

She started when her husband abandoned her to start a new family and she was left alone with her two small children, so she saw the need to be innovative and look for something as a source of income.  That was when she started making sales to feed her family.  Before that she only did the household chores and took care of her children.  Then everything changed and she started being both father and mother to her family.

She buys her supplies in the closest city or in her own town.  She buys only in small quantities and this way manages to get ahead and see her family grow.

The loan she's requesting from Fundación Campo is to improve her house, where she has lived for many years and which she hasn't been able to improve because she lacks the resources.  She's going to buy bricks, cement, and rebar.

This way she'll be able to improve her house and live in a more decent, healthful, and above all secure way, because for work she needs to go out and leave her house.  Her life will improve in that she'll be able to work without thinking about it.  She'll also be able to make the changes that are difficult with her own resources and have the personal satisfaction of being able to contribute as a single mother to creating better conditions.

For the future she only thinks about giving her children the living conditions she herself wasn't able to choose.  She also wants her children to study and be good people in society in the future.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, and rebar

loans.name: Nigora

texts.en: Nigora is 31 years old. She is married and has 3 children who are not yet adults. She has always wanted to provide her children with good education. Because her husband’s income is not enough to provide the family with a good quality of life, Nigora has decided to start a new business in animal husbandry. The income she will generate will contribute to her household’s finances. Nigora completed a course on "How to Get Ahead" through a women's organization and developed business skills. Her children will help her with business. We are confident that Nigora will be a very successful businesswoman as she is hardworking and smart. She is asking for a loan of 5000 TJS to buy cattle for her new business. Nigora awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle for organizing a new business

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 42 years old, married and has six children. Her husband is a farmer who raises corn in their field. With her determination to help her husband meet their family's needs, Vilma plants a large area of vegetables in their field and sells to buyers at harvest time.

Vilma wants to harvest her vegetables without damage and insects in order to encourage more buyers. She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy herbicides to spray on her planted vegetables. Vilma anticipates producing a better quality of vegetables, selling more, and earning a higher income.

loans.use: to buy herbicides to spray on her planted vegetables.

loans.name: Ma.emma

texts.en: Ma. Emma is a 48-year-old married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She has 4 children. The oldest child is 18 while the youngest is 4. Fishing is the family's source of income. Ma. Emma's husband is a fisherman, and she sells the fish, shrimp, and crabs he catches. They have been fishing for more than 10 years. Ma. Emma has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy nylon, rope, fish net, and other fishing materials, in order to increase the volume of their catch. In the future, Ma.Emma would like to expand her business to support her family as well as to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy nylon, rope, fish net, and other fishing materials

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
This is Antonia, 32, a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Ismael, her business partner, and the father of her child. Antonia and her husband manage their household while operating their business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Antonia operates a phone accessory business, selling items such as batteries, cases, and chargers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and residents of the local community. She earns a minimum of 2000 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy batteries, cases, chargers, and other accessories to expand her product inventory. 

Antonia hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years, and she dreams of giving her child a good, quality education. Every week she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of phone accessories like batteries and chargers

loans.name: Mealii

texts.en:
Mealii is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For over five years, Mealii has sold fruits and vegetables, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is seasonality, especially during the rainy season when it becomes difficult to operate. 

With the requested loan of KES 25,000, Mealii wants to purchase bags of vegetables, oranges, and bananas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of vegetables, oranges, and bananas for resale.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 39-year-old, hardworking gentleman. He is the father of five children, aged 17, 14, 12, 8, and 6. Richard is a mixed farmer who raises crops and animals. He is married to Janet, who assists him with farm activities.

Richard has borrowed his second loan of KES 80,000 to purchase livestock for fattening and resale. He will use the proceeds to provide for the family's basic needs. His dream is to attain financial stability.

loans.use: to buy livestock for fattenning and resale

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo has been a fisherman for 11 years now. He is from CPG Bohol. He is married with four children. He and his wife work hard to earn a living. While he is fishing, his wife weaves mats. 

He is asking for a loan to buy  fish nets, bamboo, and plywood that he can use for his boat maintenance. His income provides food and school fees for his children. He hopes that someday all his children will finish schooling and have a successful life.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, bamboo and plywood.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 39 years old and married to Faith, who sells second-hand clothes, which contributes to the family income. John has been running his motorcycle transport business for about three years, with a monthly income of KES. 30,000. 

This is his second loan from KADET LTD, and he wants to use it to buy second-hand clothes for his wife's shop. He made good profits with the previous loan and is happy. He hopes to own a fleet of public service vehicles.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes for his wife's shop and to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. He is a businessman who runs a retail shop selling cereal and poultry feed. It has been in operation for five years. Stephen now wants to invest in a poultry farm. 

He was introduced to Milango by his friends and is asking for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to buy chicks and poultry feed for the new business. The extra income will help him buy more poultry feed.

loans.use: to buy chicks and poultry feed for the new business.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa is a married woman from Ubay, in the province of Bohol. She has 3 children. The eldest child is 12, while the youngest is 5 months old. Marissa is engaged in farming; she has been growing rice for 15 years. She requested a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and more rice seedlings to increase the volume of her harvest. In the future, Marissa would like to invest in another business to support her family and send her children to school so they can have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and more rice seedlings

loans.name: Hoikhotin Group

texts.en:
Hatshi was left by her husband in the year 2002 with six kids to feed on her own. All the hopes and aspirations which she dreamt of with her husband were shattered and tumbled. In spite of all the hardships she faces, Hatshi manages to take care of all her kids by running small income-generating activities like selling rice from door-to-door, selling vegetables and by working in someone else's paddy fields to earn a daily wage.

The group is named after Hoikhotin because she was a well known lady in the surrounding areas for her hard work and endurance while she was serving as the only female chief in the village. A member of the group says that she is their inspiration and they look up to her for success. They are proud to call themselves Hoikhotin Group.

Hatshi works really hard to manage the family affairs. Besides selling rice, vegetables and earning a daily wage by working in paddy fields, she also weaves to supplement her income. She taught her second daughter weaving, and now she and her daughter co-operate and weave different traditional woven products. She is able to make a good profit now, but it is never sufficient to make savings. She has to repay the loan amount monthly and also her kids' needs are to be fulfilled.

With this Kiva loan, Hatshi is planning to get sufficient yarns from the market to use for weaving. She has decided to buy the better quality yarns, which she could not afford before, and weave the most expensive traditional wrap skirts for women to sell for a good profit. She wishes to continue her weaving business because she can carry it out irrespective of the weather. Her other activities are affected when there is a bandh [strike] in the area or when it rains heavily. Her dream is to provide her youngest daughter with the best education and support her in all possible ways to let her become an IAS (Indian Administrative Service) officer, which is considered the highest civil service in India.

The other group members are engaged in poultry, a piggery, a grocery and vegetable vending. Hatshi thanks Kiva and WSDS for the help and wishes to continue working with WSDS and Kiva. She says, “God will help and guide you and will never leave you. God bless Kiva.”

loans.use: to purchase different colours of yarn for weaving to sell woven products.

loans.name: Kitibwa

texts.en:
Kitibwa is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. He is a carpenter. Kitibwa began the trade after completing his studies in a craft course. He obtained the start-up capital from a pool together with his friend, then later moved on to set up on his own.

Kitibwa was introduced to Milango by his friends and joined to access credit. He is applying for a loan of 10,650 Kenyan shillings to purchase a planing machine and wood. He believes this will help him despite the challenge of bad debts and inflation. His ambition is to add more machines.

loans.use: to purchase a planing machine and wood.

loans.name: Nixon

texts.en:
Nixon is a 32-year-old industrious gentleman who operates a bookstore. He is married to Joyceline, who is a tailor, and is a father of one child, aged 2. 

He learned about KADET LTD from one of the credit officers who is a regular customer in the bookstore. He has operated the store for the last four years, earning an income of 30,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) from selling books as well as renting them for a fee.

He has been advanced a first loan of 50,000 KES, which will facilitate the buying of more books for the business. He will use the proceeds to expand the bookstore as well as meet the family's basic needs. Nixon's dream is to attain financial sustainability and set up a large library in Narok town.

loans.use: to buy more books for his bookstore.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 53-year-old woman from the community of Ubay, Bohol. She is married with seven children ages 13-25. Together with her husband, Teresita has been in a fishing business for 25 years now. This is to support her children's needs. 

She is asking for a loan so she can continue her fishing business. She will use her loan to buy fish net, floaters, nylon and ropes. She hopes that she can continue expanding her fishing business and send her children to school for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy fish net, floaters, nylon and ropes.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo has been operating a food stall business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She cites lack of enough capital as her major challenge in the business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a restaurant business in the future.

Here she comes again requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase foodstuff; wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs; wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil and rice.

loans.name: Shukrije

texts.en:
Shukrije is a married mother of two adult children. She is a housewife taking care of children, and her husband works as a maintainer in a construction private company with a very low salary.

Shukrije owns a small old house that is need of renovation and has not had any repairs or renovations in the last several years. Her house has an insulation problem in which it loses much heat. Every winter, it costs a lot of money to buy the coal to keep the house warm. 

Shukrije’s family always feels cold and gets sick in the winter due to the lack of heat. She needs a loan to renovate her house to buy new windows and a door. Renovation in this manner will allow her family to live a normal and healthy life. She really appreciates Kiva lenders for this help!

loans.use: To renovate the house and buy new windows and a door.

loans.name: Nyarutuntu Kalibaimukya Group

texts.en:
Wilson is a 37-year-old man with two children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He distills alcohol but also earns a salary as a civil servant. He decided to set up his current business in order to cover the daily expenses of his family, since his meager salary can hardly meet his family's basic needs and is always paid late. Price fluctuation and poor roads affect his business. His dreams are to buy a motorcycle to ease transport and to educate his children up to university.

Wilson is requesting a loan to to buy alcohol to sell. He is a member of a group where each member guarantees the others in accessing the loan.

loans.use: to buy alcohol to sell.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 4 filhos que frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É comerciante, vende roupa e produtos alimentares diversos. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (fardo de roupa, arroz, farinha, massas e outros) para aumentar a quantidade de sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja construir uma casa de alvenaria, pois actualmente vive na casa de material local, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é lidar com a concorrência no negócio.
texts.en: Sandra is married and has 4 children who attend school.  She owns the home where she lives and she does not support anyone else.  She is a business woman and sells clothes and various food items.  With this loan she plans to purchase products (bundles of clothing, rice, flour, dough, etc.) to increase her stock of merchandise.  In the future she hopes to build a brick house, as she currently lives in a house built of local materials.  For this reason she promises to make her payments on schedule in order to be able to request future loans from Hluvuku.  Her challenge is that her business faces a lot of competition.

loans.use: to purchase products (bundles of clothing, rice, flour, dough, etc.) to increase her stock of merchandise.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.pt:
Solteiro e sem filhos ainda, vive em casa dos seus pais e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É ajudante da loja e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, chapas, areia, blocos, janelas e outros) para construir a sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa e abrir uma agência de venda de pecas de automóveis, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é trabalhar mais para poder aceder a empréstimos mais altos e realizar seus sonhos.
texts.en: Rafael is single and does not have any children yet.  He lives in his parents' home and does not support anyone else.  He is a shop assistant and will use this loan to purchase construction materials (cement, metal panels, sand, blocks, windows, etc.) to build his house.  In the future, he hopes to finish his house and open an agency selling automobile parts. To achieve this he promises to make his payments on time in order to request additional loans from Hluvuku.  The challenge he faces is that he needs to work more in order to have access to larger loans and realize his dreams.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cement, metal panels, sand, blocks, windows, etc.) to build his home.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 5 filhos, o último ainda vive com ele frequentando Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 2 netos que vivem com ele.
É negociante, vende carne de vaca e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar cabeças de gado para o abate e revenda de cerne. 
No futuro deseja construir um talho e melhorar a sua viatura, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é conseguir uma viatura em boas condições para facilitar no seu trabalho.
texts.en: Manuel is married and has 5 children.  The youngest still lives with him and attends school.  He owns the home where he lives with his family, and he also supports 2 grandchildren who live with him. He is a merchant, and sells beef.  With this loan he plans to purchase cattle for slaughter and sale of the meat.  In the future, he hopes to construct a butcher's shop and make repairs to his car.  To do this he will make his loans on time and request additional loans from Hluvuku.  The challenge he faces is the need for a vehicle in good conditions to use for his work.

loans.use: to purchase heads of cattle for slaughter and sale of the meat.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 4 filhos, 1 já maior de idade, vive na casa própria com a sua familia e sustenta sua irmã mais nova que vive com ela.
É negociante, possui uma pastelaria e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (bolos, sumos, refrescos, bebidas alcoólicas e outros) para aumentar diversificar a sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja concluir a ampliação da sua casa e construir um estabelecimento comercial mais melhorado, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é ultrapassar as limitações do capital.
texts.en: Mariana is married and has 4 children, one of whom is an adult.  She owns the home where she lives with her family and also supports her youngest sister who lives with her.  She is a businesswoman and has a pastry shop.  With this loan she plans to purchase products (cakes, juices, soft drinks, alcoholic beverages, etc.) to add to and diversify her merchandise.  In the future she hopes to complete and addition to her home and build a better commercial establishment.  To do this she promises to make her loan payments on time in order to request additional loans from Hluvuku.  Her challenge is overcoming her limited amount of capital.

loans.use: to purchase products (cakes, juices, soft drinks, alcoholic beverages, etc.) to add to and diversify her merchandise.

loans.name: Teresian

texts.en:
This marks Teresian's third loan to expand her water-vending business and her green grocery business. With her previous profits, she bought hand carts for supplying water in her community. 

In the future, she hopes to own several hand carts for supplying water to communities where piped water is not easily accessible.

loans.use: to purchase more cabbages, spinach, oranges, tomatoes, and kale to sell

loans.name: Helena

texts.pt:
Viúva e mãe de 4 filhos, 3 dos quais já maiores de idade, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É jardineira de profissão e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (barrotes, chapas, cimento, areia e outros) para dar continuidade com ampliação da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa e oferecer conforto a sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é conseguir melhorar o nível de vida da sua família.
texts.en: Helena is a widow and has 4 children, 3 of whom are already adults.  She owns the home where she lives with her family and she does not support anyone else.  She is a gardener by profession.  With this loan she plans to purchase construction materials ( beams, metal panels, cement, sand, etc.) to continue work on an addition to her home.  In the future she hopes to complete her home to offer more comfort to her family.  To do this, she promises to make her payments on time in order to request additional loans from Hluvuku.  Her challenge is to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (beams, metal panels, cement sand, etc.) to continue an expansion of her home.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a teacher who resides a few miles from the outskirts of the city with his wife and four children who attend high school.

Juma is a second time borrower of UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd (MDI), and is applying for a loan of UGX 2,000,000. He used his first loan to complete the interior of his rental units. 

He is applying for this loan to finish the exterior of his rental units and to install electricity so that they can be occupied by tenants. Once occupied, these rental units will provide him with the income necessary to meet his family's needs. 

Juma has future plans of setting up two more rental units and educating his children to the highest level attainable.

loans.use: To finish plastering his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional kerosene to sell

loans.name: Omar Enrique

texts.es:
Omar, 22 años de edad, originario de la comarca El Jazmín en las afueras de Teustepe, de oficio agricultor, tiene 1 hijo de 1 año de edad. Sus inicios fueron desde los 8 años de edad cuando trabajaba junto con sus padres, limpiando terrenos y sembrando hortalizas y granos básicos. Actualmente  siembra maíz, frijol y trigo , también cuando no trabaja en siembras viaja a Costa Rica  para trabajar como mozo en finca cafetalera  con el dinero que ahorra lo utiliza para invertir en las mejoras de su casa. 
Él está buscando financiamiento para comprar abono, fertilizantes, plaguicidas y pago de mano de obra para sembrar maíz y frijol. Pues la temporada está por comenzar y necesita estos insumos  para  sacar su producción con calidad. Uno de sus planes futuros es comprar 5 manzanas de tierra y mejorar la reproducción de sus animales.
texts.en:
Omar is 22 years old and is originally from the region of El Jazmín outside of Teustepe, and is a farmer. He has one son who is 1 year old. His beginnings were at the age of 8 when he worked with his parents, cleaning up land and planting vegetables and basic grains. Currently he grows corn, beans, and wheat. Also, when he is not working to sow crops, he travels to Costa Rica to work as a helper in a coffee farm. He uses the money he saves to invest in home improvements. 

He is looking for financing in order to buy manure, fertilizer, insecticides, and pay for labor to sow corn and beans. The season is about to start and he needs these supplies in order to obtain a good-quality product. One of his future plans is to buy 5 plots of land and improve the breeding of his animals.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, insecticides, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Porvenir Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Porvenir está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Concepción, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aun se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona de difícil acceso, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.
La Sra. Adela es parte de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles de todo tipo, todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas para poder ayudar a su familia por medio de ese trabajo. Ella es muy trabajadora y cuenta que su mayor sueño es que su comunidad tenga mayor seguridad y mejor acceso a la comunicación.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de verduras, carnes, condimentos, y demás insumos para poder seguir trabajando y teniendo los ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The group Porvenir is in its third cycle of the program of the women's committee. It is from the city of Concepción, which is in the region a bit far from the center zone and is still growing. It is difficult to access, which is why the members of this group want to fight to keep growing and give the area where they live a better atmosphere and they want it to continue growing slowly. 

Adela is part of this group. She works selling food of all types. Every day she works starting at very early hours in order to be able to help her family through that work. She is very hard-working and says that her big dream is that her community has better security and better access to communication. 

She is requesting this loan in order to purchase vegetables, meat, condiments, and further supplies in order to be able to continue working and having the income to help her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, and further supplies.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Señor Juan tiene 61 años es separado y tiene 5 hijos todos mayores, que trabajan de forma independiente y lo ayudan en lo que pueden.
Trabaja como chofer de colectivo hace más de 30 años, según con lo cual pudo ayudar a su familia. Comenta que a este trabajo también se dedica toda su familia.  Además nos comenta que su mayor deseo es seguir creciendo como micro-empresario y por eso es que está luchando tenazmente.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de repuestos para su colectivo, como ser: engranajes, juego de aros, pistones ya que con esto podrá dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juan is 61 years old and separated. He has 5 grown children who work independently and help him when they can. 

He has worked as a bus driver for more than 30 years, which was how he was able to help his family. He comments that his whole family does this kind of work. He further comments that his greatest wish is to continue growing as a small business and that is why he is fighting tenaciously. 

He is requesting this loan in order to be able to invest in the purchase of replacement parts for his bus, like gears, sets of rings, and pistons. With this, he will be able to give better service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts like gears, sets of rings, pistons, etc.

loans.name: La Alegria Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado La Alegria está en su ciclo número 1 del programa comité de mujeres, donde casi todas tienen actividades productivas y donde todas se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo  la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza el cual les permite saber en qué situación económica se encuentran, están integradas por 14 señoras de las cuales más de 70% ya superaron la línea de pobreza, es decir tienen un ingreso medio.
Felicita es parte de este grupo, ella se dedica a la manicura, hace muy buen servicio y es con ello que está saliendo adelante con el trabajo que hace. Sus clientes mismos son quienes le hacen publicidad y así va ganándose una buena fama. Ella con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo está saliendo adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de esmaltes, acetonas, limas, y demás productos para poder seguir haciendo el trabajo que hace y así también mejorar la economía de su familia.
texts.en: The group called La Alegria ("The Joy") is in its first cycle of the program from the women's committee, where almost all participate in productive activities and everyone helps each other get ahead. They are making a survey on the elimination of poverty which allows them to know the economic situation they are in. The group consists of 14 women, more than 70% of whom have now risen above the poverty line, meaning they now make an average income. Felicita is part of this group. She dedicates herself to giving manicures, and provides great service with which she moves ahead with the work she does. Her clients themselves provide publicity and that is how she has gained popularity.With a lot of sacrifice and effort, she is achieving. She is asking for this loan to buy nail polish, acetone, nail files, and other products to be able to continue doing her work and this gain more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy nail polish, acetone, nail files, and other products.

loans.name: Virgen De Caacupe Group

texts.es:
El grupo Virgencita de Caacupe está en su ciclo número 5, y están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, el cual les permitirá medir los ingresos de cada una, gracias a esto se sabe que 5 de estas mujeres tienen un ingreso muy bajo, y esto permitirá que ellas entiendan su situación y se esfuercen más.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Primitiva, quien hace venta de comidas, hay que destacar que le va muy bien ya que tiene mucha habilidad con los comestibles y le va cada vez mejor. Ella es muy trabajadora y todo lo que hace es por su familia y seres queridos.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para seguir haciendo sus comestibles, como por ejemplo, carnes, verduras, etc, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group Virgencita de Caacupe is in its fifth cycle and are surveying how to eliminate poverty, which allows them to measure each other's incomes. Thanks to this they know that five of these women has a very low income, and this permits them to understand their situation and make an even bigger effort.

One of the members is Primitiva, who sells food. It's important to emphasize that this is going very well for her because she is very good with food and gets better every time. She is a hard worker and everything she does is for her family and her loved ones. 

She is asking for this loan to buy ingredients to make her food, such as meat, vegetables, etc, all which will help her to make a more concrete plan for her business, which will help her improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Elber

texts.es:
El Sr. Elber es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero, sin hijos, es una persona muy trabajadora que día a día lucha por salir adelante y de esa forma mejorar su vida y la de su familia.
Tiene un automóvil en el cual trabaja como taxi de pasajeros en un cruce de la ciudad, tiene muy buena clientela, ya que el es muy trabajador honesto y de buen trato con sus clientes. El quiere seguir trabajando  para poder seguir ayudando a su familia con todo lo que tiene en sus posibilidades.
Solicita este crédito para darle un tratamiento de chaperia y pintura a su automóvil y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Elber is from the town of Santaní. He is 28 years old, single without children, and is a very hardworking person who fights day after day to move forward and thus improve both his life and that of his family.

He has a car which he works with as a taxi around the town. He has a very good clientele because he is a very honest worker and treats his clients well. He continues to work to help his family with everything possible. He is asking for this loan to get a treatment for the metal plates and paint of his car and thus to continue working as he has been. He is grateful for this opportunity he has received.

loans.use: to repair metal plates and paint.

loans.name: Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Niño Jesus está en su tercer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza el cual les ayuda a saber la situación económica de cada una, donde 3 de las 16 señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, con ingresos muy bajos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Irma, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, que es un ingreso bajo.  Ella se dedica a la venta a la venta de chipas el cual es un alimento típico paraguayo y es gracias a este trabajo que ayuda a su familia. Es una persona muy trabajadora que se esfuerza por salir adelante y mejorar la vida de ella y su familia.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para poder seguir haciendo chipas para la venta, como ser harina de almidón, queso, anís, queso manteca y demás insumos para poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The group named Niño Jesus is in its third cycle in the women's committee program, where they join commit themselves to work and help each other so everyone can achieve. They are surveying how to eliminate poverty, which allows them to measure each other's incomes. Thanks to this they know that three of the 16 women have a very low income.

One of the members is Irma, whose income level was around level one, which is a low income. She dedicates herself to selling Paraguayan cheese buns, which is a typical Paraguayan food, and it is thanks to this work that she can help her family. She is a very hardworking person who pushes herself to achieve and better both her life and that of her family.

She is asking for this loan to buy ingredients to be able to continue making cheese buns for sale, which include starch flour, cheese, anise, manteca cheese, and other ingredients to be able to keep working.

loans.use: To buy starch flour, cheese, anise, manteca cheese, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 44 years old and lives in the community of Airport with her husband and children. All of her children are in school and range in age from 10-20 years old. Florence has been selling fresh fish in the market for 10 years now; her aunt taught her how to sell, enabling her to establish her fish business. She makes more profits and spends nine hours a day on her business six days a week.

Florence is requesting a loan to buy more fresh fish for her business. She plans to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish for her business

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Rosa Mística  está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 3  se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza y están luchando por salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias por medio de su trabajo en equipo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Salvadora, quien en su última encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir que tiene ingresos muy bajos. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo es que ella quiere ir mejorando sus ingresos y los de su familia. Entre el trabajo que ella hace es la venta ambulante de productos de mercería, como ser prendas, calzados, ollas y demás, y también se debe destacar el trabajo que ella hace por ir creciendo.
La Sra. solicita de este crédito para la compra de productos para montar un pequeño kiosko en su casa y poder complementar con sus ventas, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group named Rosa Mística is in its third cycle in the women's committee program, where they join commit themselves to work and help each other so everyone can achieve. They are surveying how to eliminate poverty, which has let them know that three of them are below the poverty line. They are fighting to achieve and help their families though teamwork.

One of the members is Salvadora, who now finds herself around the poverty level one, which means that she has a very low income. Through her effort and work she continues to want to improve her earnings and those of her family. In this work she makes sells men's products like ties, underwear, pots, and more. One should emphasize that her work is growing.

She is asking for this loan to buy products to put in a small kiosk in her house and to be able to complement it with her sales, which will help her gain a concrete business plan, which will help her improve her income.

loans.use: to buy supplies to open a kiosk

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a second-time borrower of UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd (MDI) and is applying for 2,500,000 Uganda shillings. He resides in the outskirts of the city with his wife and four children, two of whom attend school. He sells fish in two various markets as his main source of income, and this has enabled him to build a small house and educate some of his children.

He applied for the loan purposely to expand his business and renovate his house that is in a sorry state. His future plan is having his house renovated and giving his children a good education. He is confident that with the partnership of Kiva lenders and Ugafode, his dreams will be a step closer to reality.

loans.use: To renovate his house.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Renacer está en su ciclo número 14º es un grupo que trabaja arduamente para poder dar a sus hijos a darles una vida sin privaciones, todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza el cual les ayuda a saber el nivel de ingresos de cada una, donde 3 se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, con un ingreso muy bajo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Evangelina, quien se dedica a la venta ambulante de prendas de todo tipo, como ser remeras, camisas, pantalones y demás. En sus ventas le está yendo bien, ya que siempre tiene buenos productos. Es por medio de este trabajo que está dando a su familia todo lo que necesitan para ir mejorando su calidad de vida.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas varias, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir con sus ventas y ayudando por medio de esos ingresos a su familia.
texts.en:
The group named Renacer (To be reborn) is in its 14th cycle.  It is a group that works arduously to give its children a life without deprivation.  All the women work and help each other get ahead in life.  They are taking a survey on the elimination of poverty which helps them know the level of income of each one, where three are found below the poverty line with a very low income.

One of the members is Señora Evangelina, who makes a living as a street vendor of all kinds of clothing, such as t-shirts, blouses, pants, and others.  Her sales are doing well because she always has good products.  It is by means of this work that she is giving her family all that they need to go on improving their quality of life.

She asks for this loan to be able to invest in various garments so that she can continue with her sales and, through this income, help her family.

loans.use: to buy garments to sell.

loans.name: Mahfirat

texts.ru: Махфират, женщина в возрасте 49 лет. Она замужем и имеет четверо детей. Вот уже как 15 лет Махфират ведёт свой маленький бизнес. Она торгует на рынке продуктами питания. Этот бизнес приносит хоть и не большой доход, но ей это помогает содержать свою семью, так как её муж приносит тоже небольшой доход в семью со своей работы. Он работает водителем такси. Махфират уже несколько лет кредитуется в Арванде и является одним из лучших, добросовестных и пунктуальных клиентов. Предыдущие кредиты она получала для реализации своего бизнеса, а сейчас она запрашивает кредит для построения дома для своего сына. Её старший сын собирается женится, и поэтому Махфират со своим мужем хотят построить сыну дом рядом со своим домом, чтобы сын со своей женой жил неподалёку от своих родителей. Сейчас Махфират запрашивает кредит для покупки строительных материалов для постройки дома. Она благодарна Арванд за оказываемую ей поддержку.
texts.en: Mahfirat is a woman 49 years of age.  She is married and has 4 children.  She has been running her own small business for 15 years.  She sells food goods at a market.  This business brings in a small income, but it helps provide for her family since her husband also earns little from his work.  He works as a taxi driver.  Mahfirat has been a borrowers with Arvand for several years and is one of its best, most honest and punctual clients.  She used her previous loans to establish her business and now she is borrowing to build a home for her son.  Her oldest son plans to be married and therefore, Mahfirat and her husband want to build a house not far from their own so that the son and future wife will live not far from them.  This loan will be used to buy building materials.  She is grateful to Arvand for their support.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza, de 49 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 3 hijos mayores a quienes continúa brindándoles protección y apoyo necesario para su futuro, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo.Maritza a la venta de productos comestibles como arroz, pan, azúcar, huevos, leche, embutidos y otros productos de uso continuo como desodorantes, perfumes, gel, jabones y otros accesorios.Su negocio esta instalado en su hogar ubicado en la calle mas concurrida de su sector. Su mercadería la renueva cada 2 o 3 días dependiendo de la fluidez de las ventas invirtiendo siempre una buena cantidad de dinero por cada compra que realiza.Hace un año empezo en este negocio y tiende sola. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede utilizar su tiempo para hacer otras actividades típicas de ama de casa, afirma que las ganancias que recibe semanalmente son muy lucrativas y eso le brinda la tranquilidad necesaria para enfrentar los gastos básicos de su hogar, desea continuar desarrollando esta actividad implementándolo con mayor cantidad de productos y artículos de primera necesidad.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000 soles para la compra de productos comestibles necesarios para la venta en su bodega tales como arroz, aceite, pan, azúcar, huevos, leche, embutidos y otros.
texts.en:
Maritza, 49, is married and has 3 grown children to whom she continues to provide protection and the necessary support for their future. She lives in her own home together with her husband. Maritza sells groceries like rice, bread, sugar, eggs, milk, sausages, and other daily use products like deodorants, perfumes, gel, soap and other accessories. She runs her business out of her home which is located on the busiest street in her area. She restocks her merchandise every 2 or 3 days depending on the level of sales, always investing a good amount of money in her purchases. 

She started this business a year ago and runs it on her own. What she likes most about her work is that she can use her time to do other activities typical for a housewife. She says that her weekly earnings are very lucrative and this gives her a sense of calm that she will be able to cover their basic household costs. She continues to improve her business, increasing the quantity of products and basic goods. On this occasion she asks for 2000 soles to buy groceries like rice, oil, bread, sugar, eggs, milk, sausages and other things for sale in her store.

loans.use: to buy food products like rice, sugar, oil and other things.

loans.name: Khudoiberdi

texts.ru: Худойберди 49 лет. Он живет в районе Шахритус на юго-западе Таджикистана. У него жена, сын и трое дочерей. Сын в настоящее время находится на заработках в загранице. Худойберди имеет 0,20га орошаемой земли при дворе дома, где он со своей семьей занимается растениеводством. Одновременно Худойберди хочет начать новый бизнес, а именно заняться купле-продажей крупнорогатого скота. У него есть опыт и все условия для содержания скота. С этой целью он обратился за кредитом для купли и продажи крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Khudoiberdi is 49 years old. He lives in the Shahrituz region of south-western Tajikistan. He has a wife, a son, and three daughters. His son is currently working abroad. Khudoiberdi has 0.20 hectares of arable land around his house where he and his family grow crops. At the same time, Khudoiberdi would like to start a new business, specifically he wants to raise and sell cattle. He has experience and the right facilities for keeping animals. With that goal in mind, he is asking for a loan to help with the new business.

loans.use: Raise and sell cattle

loans.name: Narciso

texts.es:
Narciso, 55 años de edad, es de la comunidad El Rancho, en las afueras de Teustepe, tiene 1 hijo el cual vive independiente, en su casa vive su padre que esta ancianito. 
 Narciso se dedica a la siembra de maíz desde muy joven  pero también se dedica  a la compra y venta de ganado vacas y terneros también vende la leche  que le proporcionas sus vacas de ordeño. Narciso cuenta que cuando el empezó a trabajar hace muchos años la mama le regalo un caballo que después lo vendió 
para comprar una ternera y fue apoco a poco fue adquiriendo sus animales para trabajar. Hoy posee  varias vaquitas la cuales se le han ido reproduciendo siempre para realizar sus trabajos de huertas de maíz actividad que realiza con ayuda de mozos a los que les paga por cada dia que le ayudan y una vez que cosecha el maíz lo vende aquí mismo en la comarca para evitarse gasto de transporte.  Sus expectativas es ir aumentando sus vaquitas de ordeño. 
 Narciso está solicitando este crédito para  comprar  terneros para engordarlos.  Él dice que el préstamo le servirá  de mucho ya que el como el compra y vende ganado con el dinero disponible tendrá mas oportunidad de invertir más y buscar mejores ganancia para seguir creciendo como agricultor.
texts.en:
Narciso, who is 55 years old, is from the community of El Rancho, on the outskirts of Teustepe. He has one son, who lives independently. His father, who is elderly, lives in his house.

Narciso has been raising corn since he was very young, but he also buys and sells cattle and calves. He also sells the milk that his milk cows give. Narciso relates that when he began to work many years ago, his mother gave him a horse that he later sold to buy a calf, and little by little he acquired his working animals. Now he has several young cows that are always reproducing to do his work in his corn fields, work that he does with the help of workers whom he pays for every day that they help him. Once he harvests the corn, he sells it here in the district to avoid the cost of transportation. His expectations are to continue increasing his herd of milk cows.

Narciso is applying for this loan to buy calves to fatten. He says that the loan will help him a lot since as he buys and sells livestock with the available money, he will have more opportunities to invest more and seek better earnings to continue growing as a farmer.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Muhtaram

texts.ru: Мухтарам живет в сельской местности, в далёком от города кишлаке. Она имеет большой двадцатилетний опыт в сфере животноводство и знает все тонкости этого дела. От скотоводство получает свой доход, которое тратит на жильё, учебу детей и проживания.  Мухтарам имеет 5 коровы и 7 баранов. Она также доит корову и получает парное и вкусное молоко.  Продавая молоко, она получает доход. Так как от скота Мухтарама получает сезонный доход, она также работает в местном ресторане помощником по хозяйству и покрывает ежедневные расходы семьи.  Сын помогает ей в скотоводстве и часто выводит скот на пастбище.    Мухтарам планирует купить крупно рогатый скот  и корма для них, но не имеет достаточную сумму на руках.    Мухтарам решила обратится в МДО «Арванд» за кредитом. Очень надеется найти решения своих задач приобретённым кредитом. Заранее благодарит   МДО «Арванд» за доверие и поддержку.
texts.en: Muhtaram lives in a rural area a long way from the city of Kishlak. She has an extensive 20 years of experience in animal husbandry, and knows all the details of the trade. Raising animals earns her income, which she uses on housing, her children's education, and living expenses. Muhtaram has 5 cows and 7 sheep. She milks one cow, which gives her fresh, delicious milk which also brings in income. Since income from livestock is seasonal, she also works as an assistant at a local restaurant, which covers the family's everyday expenses. Her son helps with with the animals, and often takes them to pasture. Muhtaram is planning to buy more cattle and also feed for them, but doesn't have enough money at hand. She decided to ask Arvand for a loan, which she hopes with help her meet her goals. She would like to thank the organization in advance for its support and trust in her.

loans.use: to buy cattle and feed

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru: Хуршед житель района Шахринав. Ему 40 лет. Он женат и у него сын и дочь школьного возраста. Вместе с ними также живут его отец, брат и племянница. У Хуршеда высшее образование. Он в городе Душанбе работал в фирме по изготовлению баннеров на заказ и приобрел большой опыт в этой области. Теперь Хуршед хочет открыть свою маленькую типографию в своем районе. Для этого он уже получил лицензию, нашел хорошее место для деятельности. Однако, чтобы закупить необходимое оборудование и начать бизнес, он нуждаетя в кредите. Хуршед запрашивает кредит для приобретения печатающего оборудования для изготовления баннеров на заказ. Он надеется на успешное начало бизнеса.
texts.en: Khurshed lives in the Shahrinav district. He is 40 years old, married, and has a school-age son and daughter. His father, brother, and niece also live with them. Khurshed has a college education. He worked in a banner production company in Dushanbe and gained significant experience in the area. Now he would like to open his own small print shop in his area. Toward this goal he already got a license and found a good location. However, he needs a loan to buy the necessary equipment. Khurshed is asking for a loan in order to buy equipment for printing banners to order. He hopes to open his business soon.

loans.use: Buy equipment for printing banners to order.

loans.name: Azalia

texts.en:
Azalia is an 80-year-old married man with five children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a cattle keeper and also practices agriculture, mainly growing maize and bananas to sell. 

Unpredictable weather changes and price fluctuations affect his milk production and profits. His vision is to run a dairy. 

He never got a chance to go to school, but his dream is to educate his children up to university. Azalia intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his child.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his child

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité  Mujeres emprendedoras está en su tercer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras, donde cada una se esfuerza por salir adelante. Ellas son de una zona muy alejada donde es un poco difícil el acceso y de poca comunicación.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Wilma, quien tiene una despensa en la cual trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas. Ella comenta que le está yendo muy bien en su tienda ya que tiene muy buena clientela y buena venta, pues siempre da a sus clientes muy buena atención. Wilma y sus compañeras luchan y trabajan no solo por crecer en sus microemprendimientos sino también quieren ayudar a que su comunidad crezca y mejoren.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder seguir surtiendo su despensa como bebidas, leche, verduras, carne y demás.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres Emprendedoras" (Entrepreneurial Women) is in its third loan cycle in the program for entrepreneurial women, where each one strives to advance. They are from a very remote area where access is a little difficult and there is little communication. 

One of the members is Señora Wilma, who has a store where she works every day from a very early hour. She comments that it is going very well for her in her store, since she has many good customers and good sales, since she always gives her customers very good attention. Wilma and her companions strive and work not only to grow in their microenterprises but they also want to help their community grow and improve. She is applying for the loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of supplies such as beverages, milk, vegetables, meat, and other items to be able to continue stocking her store

loans.use: to buy beverages, milk, vegetable, meat, and other items for her store.

loans.name: Romano

texts.en: Romano is a 55-year-old married man with three children between the ages of 10 and 22. He sells bananas and has been in this business for six years with most of his customers local residents. Romano plans to use this loan to buy more bananas for sale. He faces the challenge of insufficient capital which prevents him from transporting the bananas to the market. He plans to use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children and start other income-generating activities. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM and he hopes to be a regional supplier in five years' time.

loans.use: to increase his supplies of bananas

loans.name: Damas Unidas Group

texts.es:
Damas unidas es el grupo integrado por 14 mujeres de la ciudad de Curuguaty, donde todas ellas trabajan y se ayudan para salir adelante. Son de una ciudad bastante alejada de la zona céntrica, donde no tienen mucho acceso a las vías de comunicación, y juntamente uno de los objetivos de ellas es poder ir mejorando su barrio con la ayuda de todas.
Celia, quien es una persona que trabaja arduamente por su familia, es un gran ejemplo de trabajo, ya que ella se dedica a la elaboración de jabones de todo tipo. Ella es muy buena en lo que hace y comenta que hace pedidos para muchos lugares, y con ello ayuda a mantener a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de glicerinas, colorantes y demás para poder seguir haciendo los jabones que vende, ya que por medio de este esfuerzo está ayudando a su familia. Sueña ella con que su barrio vaya mejorando y creciendo.
texts.en:
"Damas Unidas' (Women United) is a group  from the city of Curuguaty. It consists of 14 women. They all work and they help each other to advance. They are from a city quite remote from the central region, where they don't have much access to the means of communication, and together one of their goals is to be able to continue improving their neighborhood with the help of everyone.

Celia, who is a person who works hard for her family, is a great example of their work, since she makes soap of every type. She is very good in what she does, and she comments that she makes orders for many places, and with this she helps to support her family. She is applying for this loan to purchase glycerin, coloring, and other supplies to be able to continue making the soaps that she sells, since through this effort she is helping her family. She dreams of her neighborhood continuing to improve and grow.

loans.use: to buy glycerin, coloring, and other supplies to make soap

loans.name: Otilio

texts.es: Otilio de 61 años de eadd es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su hijo. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y su hijo se dedica a ser agricultor siembra maíz y frijol con las ventas que realiza cubri algunos gastos de su hogar.Don Otilio desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso a solicitado un crédito el cual le permita comprar: insecticidas y fertilizantes asi como los muestra en la foto para seguir cultivando sus semillas y tenga una buena cosecha y darle el pan de cada dia a su familia.
texts.en:
Otilio is a 61-year-old gentleman who is very responsible with his household obligations. He has always been known for providing the best for his son. Otilio currently lives with his wife and son. He is a farmer who grows corn and beans. Through his sales, he is able to cover some of the household expenses.

Don Otilio wants to increase his sales. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can buy insecticides and fertilizers, as indicated in the photograph. He will proceed with planting seeds so that he can have a good harvest and provide for his family’s daily needs.

loans.use: to buy insecticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Jose Hugo

texts.es:
El seños José Hugo tiene 56 años de edad, esta casados con la señora Leonor de 49 años de edad, son originarios de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo, el señor José Hugo es chofer de su propio taxi en el cual genera sus ingres.
